Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 100.00 nuevo soles comprará cinco docenas de  cierres, botones, ligas y pretinas para los buzos.  La señora trabaja junto con su hija y esposo, quien es profesor.

La señora desea abrir una tienda de ropa deportiva bien surtida para poder tener más ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas que reciben respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the 'Las Amigas' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She did not complete her higher education.

Roxana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling clothes such as tracksuits, t-shirts, etc.

Roxana will use this new loan for 100 soles to buy five dozen fasteners, buttons, straps and waistbands for tracksuits.  She works together with her daughter and her husband, who is a teacher.

Roxana would like to open a well-stocked store selling sports clothing in order to make more profits.  What she most likes about her community bank are the business talks that they receive.

loans.use: to buy five dozen fasteners, buttons, straps and waistbands

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena de 37 años, esta casada con Alejandro de 43 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos habitan  en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Filomena, es una mujer consecuente en sus labores, desde muy pequeña aprendió a labrar la tierra, actividada que lo aprendió de sus queridos padres y hermanos. Cuando se comprometió con Juan, decidieron juntos comprar una parcela de cacao, con ello les generaría ingresos económico y poder ofrecer un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella para producir un producto de calidad se levanta muy temprano para luego enrumbar a su parcela agrícola donde pasara la mayor parte de su tiempo cuidando sus plantas de cacao en compañía de su esposo, quien siempre está al pendiente de su siembra. Filomena esta muy contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, ya que es un producto reconocido y bien posesionado por la calida que tiene. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar jornaleros para sacar la maleza de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Filomena is 37 years old and married to 43-year-old Alejandro.  They have seven children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.  Filomena is a woman who consistent in her work.  When she was very young, she learned to work the land, an activity that she learned from her beloved parents and siblings.  When she got engaged to Juan, they decided to jointly buy a plot of land for sowing cacao.  This would make them financial income and they would be able to offer their family a better life.  In order to produce a good-quality product, Filomina gets up very early and heads off to her plot of farmland where she spends most of her time caring for her cacao plants, together with her husband who is always looking after their crops.  Filomena is very happy with the work that she does as it makes her good financial income because her product is well-known and in good demand because of its quality.  

This is Filomena's second loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will invest the 2,000 soles she is requesting in hiring laborers to weed her cacao fields.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos independientes.  Estudió solo la primaria (incompleto).
	
Jacinta trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas.

Su nuevo préstamo será de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles con lo que comprará cuatro cajas de tuna (fruta) para su respectiva venta. Nos cuenta que ella se ayuda económicamente lavando ropa ajena y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de ladrillos.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar cada vez sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the 'Las Amigas' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are independent.  Jacinta only studied at elementary school and did not complete her studies there.

Jacinta has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for five years.  She invested her previous loan for 200 soles in her fruit-selling business.

Jacinta will use her new loan for 200 soles to buy four boxes of prickly pear (a fruit) to sell.  She tells us that she makes additional money washing other people's clothes and her husband works for a brick company.

Jacinta would like to continue in her business and continue improving her income.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of prickly pear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out work on her diner premises

loans.name: Calle 1 De Enero (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que desde hace algunos años decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido  de mucho, ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nora, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  12 y 9 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de ebanistería.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para generar sus propios ingresos hace dos años atrás instalo un pequeño negocio en su casa, en el cual vende materiales de ferretería, en especial los utilizados en la elaboración de muebles, ella entrega sus productos a algunos talleres de ebanistería de la localidad, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, además también allí mismo vende bidones de agua y ciertas golosinas. 

Ester crédito es para comprar bisagras, clavos, pinturas, bidones de agua y otros materiales de ferretería que  vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que le brinda la institución.
  
Su sueño es tener un gran centro ferretero.
texts.en:
The “Calle 1 de Enero” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo) known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are well known both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

This is a group of people who decided years ago to join together and form this communal bank which has been very useful for them since they’ve been able to improve their businesses thanks to the loans.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.

We met Nora, 43, here.  She’s married and has two daughters who are 12 and 9 years old.  The oldest is in secondary school and the youngest in elementary school.  Her husband works in a cabinet shop.

She’s a great housewife who set up a small home-based hardware store years ago to earn her own income.  She sells hardware supplies especially those used in furniture manufacturing.  She sells merchandise to some local cabinet making shops in her area.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm.  She also sells large jugs of bottled water and certain snacks.

This loan is to buy hinges, nails, paint, jugs of bottled water and other hardware supplies that she sells in her store.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  Her dream is to have a large hardware supply center.

loans.use: to buy hinges, nails, paint, water jugs and other hardware supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace medio año, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 100.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  su negocio de venta de golosinas, gelatinas y galletas.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, comprará una bolsa de gelatina, chupetines, dulces y una caja de galletas chocolates.  La señora vende los sábados, en las ferias de Puno y su esposo trabaja en una carpintería.

La señora desea tener una tienda comercial de abarrotes que le permita generar más ganancias.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compañerismo y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Las Amigas communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno.  She is 19 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She studied up to high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for six months.  Her first loan was for the sum of 100 PEN, money she invested in her business selling sweets, gelatin, and cookies.

With this new loan of 200 PEN, she will buy a bag of gelatin, lollipops, sweets, and a box of chocolate cookies.  She sells on Saturdays in the markets of Puno and her husband works in a carpenter's shop.

Lucia wants to have a commercial grocery store that would allow her to generate more profit.

What she likes about her communal bank are the companionship and the talks about business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of gelatin, lollipops, sweets, and cookies

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael, de 29 años, convive con gloria de 26 años que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ismael es un joven dedicado a la agricultura,  que desde la edad de 15 años trabaja de manera independiente, cultivando cacao y cítricos en el terreno que su padre le cedió como herencia. Cuando se comprometio, tuve rápidamente a sus hijos, por ello tuvo que trabajar más y así ofrecer un mejor calidad de vida. Sus productos que cultiva, es el cacao y frutas cítricas, que actualmente tiene una demanda considerable, por que sus precios de compra se mantienen en un estándar óptimo que compensa los costos de inversión. Por tal razón es que desea continuar ampliando su producción. Él esta contento con esta labor, debido a a las buenas ganancias que obtiene, por que gracias a esta actividad es que les brinda una buena educación a sus hijos. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, comprará plantas de cacao para sembrarlos en el terreno que ya lo tiene preparado.
texts.en:
Ismael, 29, lives with Gloria, 26; they have three children.  They live together in their own house located in Pichari District.  Ismael is a young man who is in farming; he’s worked independently since the age of 15 growing cocoa beans and citrus fruit on a piece of land his father passed down to him as an inheritance.  When he became engaged he quickly became a father and because of that had to work even harder to provide a better quality of life.  

The products he grows, cocoa beans and citrus fruits, are currently in very high demand so purchase prices remain at an optimal level and he recuperates the entire cost of his investment.  Because of this, he’d like to expand production.  He is happy in this work because of the good profits he earns and thanks to this activity he’s able to provide a good education for his children.

This will be his second MFP loan so he commits to repay on time.  He will use the 2000 soles to buy cocoa bean plants to plant in his field since he’s already prepared it for this.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Lenna Rosbita D.

texts.es:
Lenna es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene estudios superiores.
	
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de  prendas de vestir. 

Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/.  100.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará telas de polistel, poli-algodones, etc, estos los compra por fardos y metros.  Lenna trabaja junto con su mamá, mayormente confeccionan para pedidos.

Lenna desea que su negocio crezca, tener una empresa grande y ser una gran empresaria

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la alegría de las socias.
texts.en:
Lenna is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, single, and does not have children. Lenna received a higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 200 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling clothes.

With this new loan in the amount of 100 PEN, she will increase her business capital so that she can buy polyester fabrics, poly-cotton blends, and other materials in bales and by the meter. Lenna works with her mother, who does most of the sewing for her orders.

Lenna wants to grow her business so that she can have a large enterprise and become a successful businesswoman. What she likes about her Communal Bank is the joy of the other members.

loans.use: to buy polyester fabrics, poly-cotton blends, and other materials.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
Geronima es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 75 años D. edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos independientes  Geronima no pudo concluir la primaria.

Trabaja desD. hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 100.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. ovinos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra D. tres animales, la señora cuenta que los  engorda por tres meses y a veces los venD. al instante.  En el negocio le ayudan sus nietos.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Geronima is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 75 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three independent children. Geronima was not able to finish elementary school.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was in the amount of 100 PEN and the money was invested in her business of buying and selling sheep.

Geronima is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 PEN. The money will be invested in the purchase of three animals. Sra. Geronima will fatten the animals for three months and then sell them immediately. Her grandchildren help with the business.

Sra. Geronima wants to continue with her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy three animals.

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Elba del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 49 años  quien venta desde hace 10 años con un pequeño préstamo inicio a comercializar ropa usada, zapatos y plata entre otros productos.  Ella está casada tiene seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad y quien le ayuda en el negocio es su hija menor que todavía está soltera. 
Ella con el crédito anterior compro pacas de ropa y en productos para la venta, en el actual comprara granos básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elva del Carmen, age 49, is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Ten years ago, she used a small loan to start her business of selling used clothing, shoes, silver, and other products.  Elva is married and has six children, all of whom are grown and help with her business.  Her youngest daughter is still single.

With her previous loan, Elva bought two bundles of clothing and other products to sell.  With this loan she will buy basic grains.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, clothes, shoes and silver.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es: Godofredo, de 49 años, esta casado con Mardonia de 40 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde joven se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de cosecha, pero no tenía la certeza que actividad continuar por lo que apostó por lo que había aprendido durante todo este tiempo. Actualmente se siente feliz con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le va muy bien con las ganancias que percibe. En tiempos de cultivo y de cosecha son las épocas en el que necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen de manera rápida y oportuna, tanto en la siembra como en la extracción de sus productos. Su producto final lo vende en los Centros de Acopio de Pichari a un precio razonable. Ahora tiene como plan comprar terrenos para que siga ampliando la siembra de café, y con las ganancias podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.500 soles, lo invertirá en contratar jornaleros para que lo ayuden a podar su cafetales.
texts.en:
Godofredo is 49 years old and married to Mardonia, age 40.  They have four children and live together in their own home in the District of Pichari.  Since he was a young man, Godofredo has engaged in farming by helping his parents during the harvest season.  He was not sure whether he wanted to continue in this line of work, but he chose to continue learning throughout the entire time.  Godofredo is very pleased with the work he has accomplished and has done very well with the earnings he has generated.  The planting and harvesting seasons are the times when he needs workers who can perform the tasks quickly and timely such as sowing seeds and picking fruit.  Now he wants to buy land so that he can continue to expand his coffee crop.  The income that he will earn will provide a better quality of life for his family.

This will be his fourth loan with MFP.  Godofredo promises to be punctual with his loan payments.  This loan of 2500 PEN will be invested in the hiring of workers to help with pruning his coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos, dos D. ellos son  independientes.  Albina cuenta con estudios D. educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace dos años, su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, también se dedica a la venta D. artesanías. 

Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 600.00 nuevo soles comprará arroz, azúcar, harina, leche, huevos y gaseosas, etc. 

La señora desea mejorar su tienda y surtirla con nuevos productos.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 53 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Two of them are independent. Albina has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling groceries. She also sells handicrafts.

With this new loan of 600 PEN, Albina will buy rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, sodas, and other products. Sra. Albina wants to improve her store and stock it with new products. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María de 64 años quien se dedica a la realización de piñatas y decoración de eventos desde hace varios años. Ella tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad. 
Las otras integrantes son Rosalía de 30 años vende ropa usadas y cosméticos, ella acaba de tener su tercer hijo, y Degsy de 24 años se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
The group “Concepción” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals.  One of them is Sra. Maria, age 64, who has been selling piñatas and party decorations for several years.  She has four grown children.  

The other members are as follows:
•	Rosalía, age 30, sells used clothing and cosmetics.  She just delivered her third child.
•	Degsy, age 24, sells new and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos independientes.  Juana cuenta con estudios de educación primaria (incompleta).
	
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ovejas y venta de tunas (frutas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres ovejas o chanchos para su engorde para las fiestas de año nuevo.  La señora nos cuenta que los animales los degolla y los vende al por menor y la tuna la vende todos los días.  Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de turismo.  

La señora desea tener un kiosco para realizar servicio y venta de productos  naturista.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal en la facilidad del préstamo y el compañerismo
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children who are independent. Juana was not able to finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of buying and selling sheep. She also sells prickly pears.

With this new loan of 600 PEN, she will buy either three sheep or pigs for fattening in time for the New Year’s festivities. Sra. Juana says the animals will be slaughtered and then sold at retail. She sells prickly pears every day. Her husband is an employee of a tourism company.

Sra. Juana wants to have a kiosk where she can provide her service and sell natural products. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the camaraderie.

loans.use: to buy three sheep or pigs.

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: Severo de 60 años, esta casado con Elvira de 62 años, fruto de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, de los que solo uno esta al lado de ella. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubucada en el distrito de Pichari. Severo es un hombre con mucha experiencia, pues desde muy joven trabaja como peon al igual que su padre, poco a poco con el pago que obtuvieron adquirieron un pequeño terreno agrícola donde instalaron plantas de cacao. Ya cuando severo tenía la mayoría de edad se caso con Elvira, quien hasta la actualidad es su adorada esposa, y además es su compañera de trabajo. Severo agradece a su querido padre por haberle dejado ese legado de enseñanzas que gracias a ello a logrado muchos beneficios y dar bienestar a su familia, como educación y alimentación a sus hijos, y quienes 4 de ellos son ya profesionales. Por todo se siente muy feliz y agradecido con MFP por el crédito obtenido anteriormente. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, invertirá en el pago de personal para que saquen la maleza de entre sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Severo is 60 years old and married to Elvira, age 62. Their relationship has resulted in seven children, but only one of them still lives with them. Severo and his family live in their own home in the District of Pichari. He is a gentleman with plenty of experience. Just like his father, Severo worked as farm laborer when he was young man. Over time, he used his wages to acquire a small plot of farmland where he grows cacao plants. When Severo married Elvira, who is currently his beloved wife, he also acquired a partner in his work. He is grateful to his father for giving him a legacy of knowledge that has provided many benefits for the welfare of his family, such as education and food for his children. Four of them are already professionals.

Severo is very pleased and grateful to MFP for the previous loan he received. This will be his second loan with MFP and he promises once again to submit his payments on time. This loan of 2000 PEN will be invested in the hiring of workers to remove weeds that are growing among his cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire workers to remove weeds.

loans.name: Elena Angela

texts.es:
La señora Elena Angela es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y carismática quien es comerciante. Su negocio es bien variado desde venta de pollo hasta ropa…etc. el cual ha sacado adelante poco a poco. Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores de los cuales el mayor es el que le ayuda en el negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio y acondicionar su cuarto poniéndole cielo rasó, cerámica y aire acondicionado.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena Angela is a hardworking, enterprising, and charismatic woman who works as a merchant. Her business involves selling a variety of products that range from chicken to clothing to other items. This business has enabled her to move forward gradually. Elena has three children, all of whom are grown. Her eldest child helps with the business.

She will invest this loan in her business and renovate a room by installing a ceiling, ceramic tiles, and air conditioning.

loans.use: to buy products for her business and to renovate a room.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija.  Cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja desde hace cuatro meses con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  su negocio venta de cerámicas. 

Su nuevo préstamo será de S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de cerámicas como ollas, platos, miniaturas, etc, la señora cuenta que los vende en Desaguadero, Cusco y Puno, para esto ella viaja a las ferias de la ciudad.  Trabaja sola en el negocio y su esposo trabaja como transportista.

La señora desea tener su casa propia y mejor su estilo de vida, sobre todo para su hijo, el mismo que se muestra en la foto

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compañerismo y la responsabilidad.

En la foto se muestra cargando a su niña, junto a ellas... su sobrino.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (Friends) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno.  She is 20 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child.  Nely has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four months.  Her first loan was in the amount of 200 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling ceramics.  

This new loan of 400 PEN will be invested in the purchase of ceramics such as pots, plates, figurines, and other items.  Sra. Nely has sold her products in Desaguadero, Cusco, and Puno and she also travels to the fairs in the city.  She works alone in her business while her husband is employed in the transportation industry.  

Sra. Nely wants to have her own home and a better lifestyle, especially for her son who appears with her in the photo.  What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the camaraderie and the responsibility.  

In the picture she is shown with her daughter, and with them her nephew.

loans.use: to buy ceramic pots, plates, figurines, and other items.

loans.name: Adela Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Adela Francisca es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 33 años quien tiene dos tortillerías. Ella con el crédito anterior amplio su negocio y con las ganancias se compró una cocina nueva.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 3, 9 y 12 años de edad respectivamente y este crédito lo piensa invertir en maíz y queso. Su meta es lograr tener un carro ya que le ayudaría al negocio.
texts.en: Adela Francisca is a hardworking, enterprising, 33-year-old woman who has two tortilla shops.  She used her previous loan to expand her business and used profits to buy a new stove.  She has three children who are 3, 9 and 12 years of age respectively.  She intends to use this loan to buy corn and cheese.  Her goal is to have a car because it will help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and cheese.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabe de 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Betzabe desde hace unos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Betzabe es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante por si sola para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Betzabe, 24, is single and lives in her parents' house, which has water and electricity, located in the district of Bambamarca in the department of Cajamarca.  The people in this area work in agriculture and livestock.

Betzabe has been raising and selling yard animals (pigs and chickens) for several years.  Her corrals, located behind her house, are appropriate and spacious.  She feeds her animals balanced feed and natural grains so they will have optimum growth.  In this way she will be able to sell them in the different markets in the area and make a good profit to pay her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With the profits she makes from the sale of her animals she will be able to cover her loan as well as have a better quality of life.

Betzabe is a woman who with effort and great determination has known how to get ahead by herself to continue helping her parents economically.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
La señora Liduvina de 66 años  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien vende de todo un poco desde bisutería, cosméticos y comida. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años y poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando.
Ella tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores, casados y con hijos. Con este crédito piensa ir a Honduras para traer mercadería.
texts.en: Liduvina, 66, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who sells a little bit of everything: costume jewelry, cosmetics and food.  She’s had the business for several years and has gradually enlarged it.  She has seven children who are all now adults, married and who have children of their own.  She plans to use the loan to go to Honduras to bring back merchandise.

loans.use: to go to Honduras to buy merchandise and clothes.

loans.name: Citlali Group

texts.es: Las señoras Camila y Hortencia son nuevas integrantes del grupo van a comprar con el prestamo azucar, aceite, jabon, refrescos, papel higienico y dulces, la señora Camila tiene 75 años de edad, ella no tiene hijos, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para surtir su tienda va a comprar azúcar, aceite, chocolates, huevo, jabón, leche, arroz, refresco, maíz, frijol, dulces, flores gladiolas, nube, polar y clavel.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años, la invito una vecina a poner la tienda y la pusieron juntas pero como la señora era sola ya no quiso seguir con el negocio , así que ella sola continuo con la tienda, su negocio es importante porque de ahí se ayuda para la comida y para pagar el teléfono y la luz, ella está orgullosa de tener su tienda de abarrotes y de trabajar en el campo en la siembra de maíz de temporal cada año lo siembra, su negocio es conocido porque ella atiende a sus clientes con bonito carácter, también le ayuda su hermana y su sobrina a atender a los clientes, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de algunas tiendas pero  cada uno ya tiene sus clientes, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para pagar los peones de la siembran, para la luz, el teléfono. Ella está planeando comprar unos cerditos y becerros para crianza y después venderlos, sus sueños y esperanzas son que Dios le siga ayudando a seguir en el trabajo. Ella está emocionada con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar lo que le falta en la tienda para estar bien surtida y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes. Los integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por su ayuda y por la confianza que les tienen y que los sigan ayudando con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Camila and Hortencia are new members of the group.  They will use their loan to buy sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, toilet paper, and sweets.  

Camila is 75 years old and does not have children.  She has a grocery store.  She requested her loan to stock her store.  She will buy sugar, oil, chocolates, eggs, soap, milk, rice, soft drinks, corn, beans, and sweets.  She will also buy gladiolas, baby’s breath, chrysanthemums and carnations.

She started her business 30 years ago.  A neighbor invited her to establish the store, and they set it up together.  The woman was single, and she did not want to continue with the business.  That is how Camila continued on with the store by herself.  Her business is important because it helps with the food, and it helps pay for the telephone and electricity.  She is proud to have her grocery store and of working in the fields.

She grows seasonal corn, which she plants each year.  Her business is well-known because she tends to her customers in a good-natured way.  Her sister and her niece also help her tend to the customers.  Her business faces competition from some stores, but each one already has their customers.  She uses the income from her business to pay the field workers and to pay for electricity and the telephone.

She is planning to buy some pigs and calves to raise and later sell.  Her dreams and hopes are that God continues helping her to continue in her work.  She is thrilled with this loan that she is going to receive.  She will buy what is lacking in the store in order to be well stocked and to give her customers better service.

The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for the help and the trust placed in them.  May they continue helping with the loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, chocolates, eggs, soap, milk, rice, soft drinks, corn, beans, sweets, gladiolas, baby’s breath, chrysanthemums and carnations.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar conocimos a la Señora Mariana, tiene 59 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos, todos son mayores de edad y dos de ellos  aun vive con ella.
 
La Señora Mariana tiene una funeraria donde vende cofres mortuorios y ofrece los servicios de sala de velación,  este negocio lo tiene desde que su esposo estaba con vida, allí trabajaban juntos pero luego que él falleció y tuvo que  hacerse cargo del negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos, allí trabaja todos los días y tiene  el negocio por más de 20 años.

Este crédito es para comprar cofres mortuorios. Lleva 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo que le han brindado sus compañeras y la institución. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  We met Mariana, 59, here.  Her husband died several years ago.  She has three children who are all now adults but two of them still live with her.

Mariana has a funeral parlor where she sells coffins and provides wake services.  She’s had the business since her husband was still alive; they used to work there together but when he died she had to take over running the business with help from her children.  She works there every day and has had the business for more than 20 years.

She will use this loan to buy coffins.  She’s been in the communal bank for 10 years and likes it because of the help and support its members and the institution have provided her.  Her dream is to continue forward in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy coffins.

loans.name: Mercy Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar vive a la señora Mercy, tiene 31 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella para ganar algo y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a varias actividades, trabaja de lunes a sábados en un almacén de ropa en la ciudad, pero en las noches y días libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, toallas, etc. deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada 15 días. Compra su mercadería en el almacén donde trabaja ya que le dan a buen precio, lleva casi dos años en su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sabanas, toallas, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido incrementar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  Mercy, 31, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 12, 10 and 8 years old.  The oldest goes to secondary school and the younger ones go to elementary school.  Her husband is a security guard.

In order to earn a bit and help her husband cover household expenses she has several activities.  From Monday through Saturday she works in a clothes store in the city but at night and on her days off she sells clothes, sheets, towels, etc. on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in the store where she’s employed because they give her a good price.  She’s been in business about two years and does quite well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like clothes, sheets, towels, etc.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because the loans have helped her enlarge her business.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Efrain

texts.es: Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es uno de los lugares conocido por clima y condiciones fértiles para siembra y crianza de ganado, lugar donde habita el Señor Ramón ,50 años de edad,  de oficio ganadero, padre de 3 hijos. Comenzó por medio de su padre ellos son originarios de San Juan de Limay un pueblo localizado en las afueras de Estelí, el trabajo desde muy temprana edad, pero en ese entonces por problemas de la guerra tuvo que salir de ahí  e irse  a vivir a la ciudad de Estelí lugar donde aprendió hacer muebles pero el sentía que quería volver a sus raíces así que vendió su casa de Estelí y se fue a vivir a Pueblo Nuevo a comprar un terreno para empezar desde cero , comenzó sembrando hortalizas , criando ganado. Hoy en día su padre y sus hijos lo ayudan a criar ganado el comercializa su producto en Pueblo Nuevo. Realizo el crédito para comprar dos vacas paridas, para ayudarse a la reproducción de reses y producir leche para vender. Ya que una de sus metas es comprar un terreno para siembra para ampliar sus siembras y sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí Municipality, is one of the places known for its climate and soil fertile for farming and livestock raising.  It’s the place where Ramón, 50, lives.  

He raises cattle and is the father of three children.  He started out thanks to his father.  They are originally from San Juan de Limay, a town located in the outskirts of Estelí.  He’s worked since he was very young.  However, back then he had to leave there and move to Estelí due to the war and he learned how to make furniture there.  He then moved to Pueblo Nuevo to buy a piece of land and start again from zero.  He started growing vegetables and raising cattle.  Today, his father and children help him care for the cattle that he sells in Pueblo Nuevo.

He took out the loan to buy two nursing cows to help him breed cattle and produce milk to sell since one of his goals is to buy a piece of farmland to expand his crops so that his children will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy two nursing cows.

loans.name: Gema Andrea

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

Aquí conocimos a Gema, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Estudia el segundo semestre de odontología en una Universidad de Portoviejo.

Ella es una chica muy estudiosa y preocupada de su futuro, ella solicita el crédito para  gastos de su educción superior, tiene que pagar el semestre universitario que está por iniciar.  Gracias a los créditos ella está sacando su carrera adelante y así espera seguir hasta terminar sus estudios, cuenta con la ayuda de la Fundación Espoir para lograr sus sueños.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para pagar el semestre universitario y comprar ciertos instrumentos odontológicos necesarios para un mejor aprendizaje. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le están dando.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a culminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every fifteen days.  We met Gema, 19, here.  She’s single and lives with her parents.  She is in second semester of dentistry at a university in Portoviejo.

She is a very studious young woman who is concerned about her future.  She requested the loan to pay for her higher education.  She has to pay tuition for the university semester that is about to start.  Thanks to the loans she’s progressing in her career and hopes to continue that way until she graduates.  She counts on Fundación Espoir’s support to reach her dreams.

She is going to use the loan to pay tuition for the university semester and to buy certain dental equipment needed for better learning.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because of the help they are giving her.  Her dreams are to complete her studies and to become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay her semester's tuition and to buy dental equipment.

loans.name: Milton Adgusto

texts.es: Milton, 40 años  de edad, originario de Estelí, humilde  agricultor, padre de dos hijos , su nivel de estudio en básico solo curso hasta sexto grado de primaria. El desde temprana edad comenzó trabajando con su papa , esto le brindo la experiencia necesaria para aprender todo acerca de la siembra de hortalizas, desde las 3 de la mañana comienza sus labores de siembra en con junto con su hermano , sus hijos en tiempo de vacaciones le ayudan a sembrar ya que ellos están en la escuela. El requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, insumos, fertilizantes para sembrar ½ manzana de tomate. Ya que con esta inversión espera sacar una producción con buena calidad y altos rendimientos  que le ayuden a salir adelante y mejorar su cosechas por lo pronto su prioridad es el bienestar de sus hijos, quiere seguir sembrando y expandir sus áreas de siembra de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Milton, 40, is originally from Estelí.  He’s a humble farmer and the father of two children.  He only completed sixth grade in elementary school.  He started working with his father at a very young age.  This gave him the necessary experience to learn everything about vegetable farming.  He starts work at 3am with his brother.  During vacation time, because they go to school, his children help with the farming.  

He needs the loan to buy manure, supplies and fertilizer to plant ½-manzana [Central American measure of land area] of tomatoes.  He expects this investment will lead to a good, high quality, abundant harvest that will help him get ahead and improve his crops.  For the present, his main priority is his children’s wellbeing.  He wants to continue to farm and to expand his vegetable producing area.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene hijos. El marido trabaja en albañilería.
 
Ella para ganar algo con la finalidad de  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos y bisutería. También trabaja de lunes a sábado en una boutique de la ciudad, pero en sus ratos libres  se dedica a sus ventas las mismas que deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, ella compra su mercadeía en Guayaquil ya que allá le salen más baratos, lleva un año con su negocio y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos, sandalias y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas,  su mamá fue quien la llevo al banco y está muy feliz por aquello. 

Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  Diana, 19, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has no children yet.  Her husband’s a bricklayer.

To earn her own income to help her husband with household expenses she is a merchant; she sells shoes and costume jewelry.  She’s also employed Monday through Saturday in a boutique in the city but she devotes her free time to her sales.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it’s less expensive there.  She’s been in business for a year and she’s done well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like shoes, sandals and costume jewelry.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because her fellow members are very united.  Her mother was who took her to the bank and she’s very happy about that.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and their two kids go to kindergarten. His home environment is relatively normal. 

He started his business in 2009 by making traditional kids' shoes. Shoe making is a skill he picked up from working in a shoe factory. Now that winter is arriving, the demand is increasing and he wants to keep up with it. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials to make more shoes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Dolly Benedicta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolly, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 15, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller mecánico. 

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 17h00. En las noches ella trabaja con un cuñado en una pizzería, por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, mientras esta en este trabajo son  sus hijas y su esposo los que atienden su tienda. Su negocio lo tiene ya hace  cinco años y con los créditos lo ha ido mejorando dia a dia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido aumentar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  Dolly, 35, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 15, 12, 8 and 6 years of age.  The two oldest go to secondary school and the two youngest are in elementary school.  Her husband works in a repair shop.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.  She works there every day from 6am until 5pm.  At night she works with a brother-in-law in a pizzeria and earns a monthly salary.  While she’s at this job her husband and daughters tend to the store.  She’s had her business for five years now and the loans have helped her improve it day to day. She will use this loan to increase the store's stock inventory.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other staple items.  

She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because she’s been able to enlarge her business thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to have the best store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is a single mom who has a two kids and lives in ger, (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two kids go to school. She started her dairy retail business in 1998 by renting a counter in a local market. She has many regular customers and many guaranteed suppliers. Now she wants to broaden the range of products she sells. Throughout the years, she has built her own home with her business profits. She is a strong and diligent woman who is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy sour milk.

loans.use: To buy sour milk.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Alfa.

Aquí conocimos a María, tiene 26 años  de edad, está soltera y aun vive en casa de sus padres. Parar ella este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas. 

Ella para poder obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su casa desde hace tres años atrás empezó con un negocio en sociedad con su papá, ellos se dedican a la venta de calzado, tienen un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, hay días que ella trabaja sola y otros con la ayuda de sus papá ya que a veces él tiene que salir a otras ciudades a comprar mercadería. Su papá viene dedicado a este negocio por 30 años y ella empezó a invertir en el mismo recién hace tres años y les está yendo muy bien ya que cuentan con buena clientela.

Este crédito es para compara calzado de todo tipo y modelos.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén sola.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Alfa communal bank meet every two weeks.  We met María, 26, here. She’s single and still lives with her parents.  For her, this is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are easy to get and because her fellow members meet their responsibilities.

To earn her own resources and be able to contribute to covering household expenses she started a business in partnership with her father three years ago.  They sell footwear.  They have a small stand in downtown Portoviejo.  They work Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm.  There are days when she works alone and others with help from her father because sometimes he has to go to other cities to buy merchandise.  Her father has been in this business for 30 years and she started to invest in it just three years go and they are doing very well because they have a good clientele.  She will use this loan to buy all types and styles of footwear.  Her dream is to have her own store all by herself.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Batgerel

texts.en: Batgerel is 39 years old and lives with her son in an apartment in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a college student. She started her women's garment retail business in 1994 by renting a counter in a local market. She is very well experienced in her field and she is known for her fashion sense. Now that winter is arriving, she needs warmer clothes to sell. She is a strong and hard working woman who says, "Now that my son has joined a college, I am short on cash to run my business." She is requesting 2,500,000 to buy more garments to sell.

loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Ger. They live in a Mongolian yurt in Uvurhangai, a province of Mongolia. His wife helps her out with his job, his elder two kids live individually, and the younger one goes to school. He started his furniture making business in 2008. He makes his products by hand. Due to the severe cold winter, he lost his all livestock. He is a hard working and diligent man who says, "Now that all of my livestock is gone, I will concentrate on my furniture business." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make furniture

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a herder, her elder two kids are college students, and the younger one is a student. She sews at home. She sews deel, a Mongolian traditional clothing, and t-shirts. After joining a sewing group in 2009, not only has her income increased, but she has also learned to sew a long range of products. Now that her demand is high, she needs to buy new machinery in order to increase the speed and quality. She is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy new sewing machinery.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machinery

loans.name: Ime

texts.en: Ime is 27 years old and married with two children. Ime is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. To earn a living, Ime owns and manages her rice plants. Ime has been doing this for four years and she earn PHP 6,000.00 per month. Ime is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000.00, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor for her rice planting. Ime has been a member of GDMPC for four years. Her future plan is to renovate her house to a cemented one.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and payment for labor cost in rice planting

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita, a 40-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising pigs to earn a living for the last 20 years. A member of PMPC for seven years, she has requested a loan of PHP 17000 to purchase feeds and vitamins for the piglets. In the future, Paulita hopes to have enough savings for family use.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana (Cuenca), esta parroquia es de clima frió, lugar que tiene una gran belleza natural y desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se  dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 41 años, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo sufre de una discapacidad y pasa a su cuidado y sus dos hijos siguientes trabajan. La casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y como pasa en casa cría cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, siembra hortalizas para la venta. Ella tambien se dedica a cuidar de sus sobrinos que son pequeños.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  tener más pollos para la venta. 

En la foto está la socia con uno de sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “10 de Agosto” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish (Cuenca).  This parish is cold climate.  It has a natural beauty and from its center one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise livestock and farm; many work at various jobs in the city.

María is 41 years old and separated from her husband but has three children who are 21, 19 and 16 years of age.  He oldest child has a disability and is in her care; the next two children both work.  She owns the house they live in.

María is a housewife and since she spends her time at home she raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens and plants vegetables to sell.  She also cares for her little nephews.

She’s been in the communal bank for four years and will use her new loan to buy chicks and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more chickens to sell.  

She appears in the photo with one of her nephews.

loans.use: to buy chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Mónica Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana (Cuenca), esta parroquia es de clima frió, lugar que tiene una gran belleza natural y desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora Mónica tiene 22 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus familiares. 

Ella se dedica a la atención de su tienda de comestibles, lleva 9 meses con su negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the communal bank "10th of August." She lives in the Saint Anne parish (Cuenca).  This parish has a cool climate and is a place of great natural beauty.  From its center, you can admire a great part of the city of Cuenca.  Its people work at the raising of animals and agriculture. Many also labor in the city at different trades.  

Mónica is 22 years old, married and as the fruit of their conjugal union, she conceived a daughter, who is now 2 years old.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They don't have their own home, so they live in the home of relatives.  

She works attending her grocery store.  She has worked at this business for the past 9 months, laboring from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.  

This is the first loan that she has made from the communal bank to which she was invited by her sister-in-law.  She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of staple goods to supply her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods.

loans.name: Diana Mariela

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia Santa Ana (Cuenca), esta parroquia es de clima frió, lugar que tiene una gran belleza natural y desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Diana tiene 29 años, casada y su esposo labora en un taller de  mecánica industrial. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de familiares.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzado en un local que es de propiedad, labora hace 6 meses en él de lunes a sábados sin un horario específico.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de calzado para su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the “10 de Agosto” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish (Cuenca).  This parish is cold climate.  It has a natural beauty and from its center one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise livestock and farm; many work at various jobs in the city.

Diana is 29 years old and married.  Her husband works at an industrial machine shop.  She does not own a house; she lives with relatives.

She sells all types of footwear in a locale she owns.  She’s been working for six months from Monday through Saturday with no fixed work schedule.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy footwear for her business.  Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Santa Ana se llama el comité formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras que se unen con el propósito de luchar por el bienestar de sus familiares. Este comité se encuentra en su ciclo número 11,  en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma, ella tiene una peluquería, la cual es su medio de subsistencia. Gracias al trabajo que realiza ella puede ayudar a su familia, dándoles por medio de su trabajo una vida digna, con las comodidades mínimas que necesitan. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, gel, spray, cosméticos y demás insumos para su peluquería, lo cual le es de suma ayuda. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estas le brindan
texts.en:
Santa Ana is a group of 16 women in Asunción. They are very motivated and work hard to provide for their families. This group is in their 11th phase of activities, and all of them attend training to achieve success and greater success.
Norma is a member who is a hairdresser.  She has done well for her family, giving them a good standard of living.  Her business is thriving and she has many satisfied clients.  She now seeks a loan to buy hair dye, gels, hairspray, cosmetics and other items.  She is very grateful to the group and to Kiva for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, gels, hairspray, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo, a 35-year-old married father of four, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where he owns and operates his motorcycle transportation service to earn a living. In business for seven years, he earns about PHP 6,000.00 each month.

A member of GDMPC for one year, Maximo is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000.00 to purchase new spare parts for better operation of his motorcycle. His future plan is to have his own big beautiful house.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for better operation of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Jean has a retail shop that sells bananas & coconut for copra. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more bananas & coconut to sell.

Jean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconut

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se reúnen un grupo de mujeres con el propósito de obtener un mejor bienestar para sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas ellas. Ellas se encuentran actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación,  donde se puede destacar la responsabilidad de ellas en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen cada una de las que integrantes además de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la señora Venancia, la cual se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para empezar su jornada laboral. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Ella misma se encarga de elaborar cada uno de los alimentos que vende. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues a los clientes les gustan sus platos. Ya que le está yendo muy bien ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y es por eso que solicita el crédito, para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y demás, los cuales son esenciales para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
In Asunción a group of women meet together with the common goal of improving their families' well-being through hard work. They are now in the 2nd phase of a  women's program,  where each one takes responsibility for different tasks and activities including repayment commitments.
Venancia tells a compelling story, rising early in the morning to start work as a food vendor. She prepares food items for sale and they are a big hit with customers.  For this reason she seeks credit and wants to invest in her growing business, to buy meat, chicken, greens, seasoning and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, greens, seasoning and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Darwin has a pigpen and sells mature & grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Darwin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Choijilsuren

texts.en: Choijilsuren is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business while the elder two children are school students and the younger one goes to kindergarten. Choijilsuren makes frames for gers (Mongolian yurts) for a living, and his wife paints them. He is well-known for his quality products. Now that winter is approaching, demand is high, and he needs more raw materials. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that my business is going well, I need to meet my demand." He is requesting 1,400,000 MNT to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Catheline

texts.en:
Catheline is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. 

Catheline has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Catheline is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. Las integrantes fijaron como su objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas.
La Sra. Cristina es la presidenta del comité está casada,  tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Ella tiene una peluquería en la cual trabaja hace ya un buen tiempo, por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. A ella le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que este trabajo es su medio de subsistencia, por lo mismo le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, maquillajes, spray, gel, shampoo, enjuague y otros para abastecer su negocio, ya que los mismos son esenciales para su trabajo diario.
texts.en: The group "Maria Auxiliadora" works to support businesswomen in the city of San Lorenzo. The group's members seek to grow their businesses as well as to advance their personal development. They are well known in the community as hardworking and serious businesswomen. Cristina is the group's leader and is married with 3 children.  She is a dedicated and innovative worker.  She runs a successful hairdressing salon and has done well for her family, giving them a good standard of living.  She enjoys her work and very much wants to grow her business  She seeks this credit to buy items needed for her business, such as hair dye, gels, hairspray, conditioner, cosmetics and other items.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, gels, hairspray, cosmetics, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Feluchie

texts.en:
Feluchie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Feluchie has a retail shop that sells bananas & coconut for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut & bananas to sell. 

Feluchie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy coconut & bananas

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 19 years.

Victoria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy meats and other ingredients for her business.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy meats and other ingredients

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a nurse while his eldest daughter is a college student and his younger two children are school students. He started his water business in 2004 by opening a well in his own yard. He provides all the water within a 1.5 km radius. It is difficult for customers to transport water; therefore, he is planning to buy a new truck to deliver the water. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita works hard to support her family. Estrellita is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Estrellita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Estrellita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Estrellita  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Park

texts.en: Park, 44 years old, sells peanuts and sugar palm and earns $3 per day. Her husband provides motorbike with a cart attached services and earns $3 per day. They have four children. One is two years old, one is studying and two are working. Each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $12 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike to transport peanuts and sugar palm to sell. She wants to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house so that she can make better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport peanuts and sugar palm to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 53 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Maria has a rope making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making business.

Maria has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Las Señoras del comité Las tejedoras, son personas muy trabajadoras,  ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades pueden invertir en sus negocios y otras las nuevas miembros iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la Sra. Norma, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de cosas, como ser, ropa, artículos de mercería y otros. Comenta que hace poco paso por una de las peores experiencias, pues falleció su bebe recién nacido, pero ella de igual manera sigue siendo muy activa en el grupo e incluso ayuda a otros grupos de la zona. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, pantalones y demás para tener más variedad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are members of the sewing group and are very hard-working.  They are very grateful for the foundation's assistance in growing their businesses and commercial activities.
The group's director, Norma, lives with her husband and children and sells varied articles such as clothing, accessories and other items. Sadly, she recently lost a newborn baby, but despite this continues to be active with the group, working with other women in her area.  The women realize that by working together they can achieve greater productivity to meet their orders.  Norma seeks this credit to buy clothing such as shirts and pants, and to offer a greater variety of items to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and other clothes

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 27 years old and is married with three children. Rasela owns and operates a business venture, running bingo games. She has four years of experience in this business. Rasela needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase game prizes. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rasela's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase game prizes.

loans.name: Bonachita

texts.en:
Bonachita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. 
Bonachita is making and peddling snacks and viands like suman or rice cake, puto and ginisang gulay. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Bonachita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bonachita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Zaannordov

texts.en: Zaannordov is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a janitor and his sons are school students. He started his taxi service in 1999 with his own car. In 2000, he was employed part-time as a driver. Now that his car is old, no one wants to sit in it and it breaks down very often so he wants to sell it and buy a newer car. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have to work in order to support my two kids. Now that my car is getting old, it is impossible to run the business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his business.

loans.name: Solomua

texts.en:
Solomua is 39 years old and is married with six children. Solomua owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Solomua needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2011, Solomua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Solomua's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Chanmarika

texts.en: Chanmarika, 31 years old, is a grocery seller and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a primary teacher earns $2 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one more is only one year old. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy more grocery goods to sell at her store.
