She wants to extend her career so she can make better income and have enough money to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell at her store

loans.name: Rhealyn

texts.en:
Rhealyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rhealyn has a retail shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Rhealyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhealyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Feviiai

texts.en:
Feviiai is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a business selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). Feviiai joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services and this will be her third loan.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Feviiai is requesting a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 800 WST or 333 USD per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric and material

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 67 years old and a widow with 12 children.

Bonifacia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Bonifacia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bonifacia has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Bonifacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pea

texts.en: Pea is 33 years old and plants yams to sell. She earns $5 per day. Her husband provides car taxi service and earns $9 per day. They have two children. One is studying and one is only three years old. Every month, she has to spend $106 on food, $5 on electricity, $18 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to feed and then sell. The loan helps her family to have a new career, feeding pigs, which can make more income for them.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Catalina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can rent a space in the public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is 46 years old and married with seven children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a business planting and harvesting taro. Serafina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.

Serafina is requesting a 1500 WST loan to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or 250 USD per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 32 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer who plants rubber trees. He earns $11 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is only 3 years old. Every month, Mao has to spend $84 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land to extend her rubber plantation. She wants to make her rubber plantation bigger than now so that her family can make more income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to extend her rubber plantation.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old. She is a widow with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elsie has been in this business for 13 years. Elsie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en:
Seira is 43 years old and married with four children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. Seira joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. 

Seira is requesting a 1500 WST loan to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 800 WST or 333 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Caacupé. Actualmente el grupo está en su tercer ciclo, integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas tienen el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus respectivas familias.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Limpia, ella vive con su marido y sus hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comidas, medio por el cual obtiene los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su marido en la manutención de la casa. Dice que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre compran de ella los alimentos que prepara. Ella al igual que sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración  de sus alimentos, como ser carnes, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The women of this community are from La Caacupé. At present, the group is in its third cycle. It is made up of 17 women, all of them friends and residents of this city. Their aim is to help each other mutually, so in this way they can help their respective families.  

The president of the committee is Limpia. She lives with her husband and children. She sells food, through which she gets the income necessary to help her husband support the home. She says that she has a lot of customers who always buy the food she makes from her. As with her fellow members, she is very satisfied with the support from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

She is asking for the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make her food such as meat, condiments, vegetables, bread products and more. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, bread products and more.

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga is 32 years old and married with four children. For the past seven years, she has owned and operated a bakery where she makes and sells a variety of goods for her community. Fofoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this will be her seventh loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Fofoga is requesting a 2700 WST loan to purchase baking equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or 208 USD per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en:
Gigina is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gigina has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Gigina requested a 23,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell. 

Gigina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gigina would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and has five children. She is married, and two of her children are in school. 

Lorna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna requested an 18,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Lorna has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 41 years old, married, and has four children. With three children in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them. 

Regina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store. 

Regina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, etc. 

In the future Regina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 21 years old and married and has two children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Serena is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Serena has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from sari-sari (general) store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Muava

texts.en:
Muava is 50 years old and married with five children. For many years, she has owned and operated a business selling hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. Muava joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this will be her third loan.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. 

Muava is requesting a 1,000 WST loan to expand her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or 208 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business by exporting her products to oversea.

loans.name: Saant

texts.en: Saant, 41 years old, is a houseife. Her husband is working in a factory earning $5.5 per day. They have two children. One is studying and one is working in the factory earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $103 on food, $7 on electricity, and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy cashews at wholesale to resell. She plans to buy a car that she can rent to the villagers to transport yams to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy cashews to sell

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se forma gracias al contacto de una de las miembros del comité. Ella organizó a sus amigas y compañeras con el propósito de ayudarse mutuamente. Todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo muy unidas.
La sra. Mirtha es una de las miembros,  esta acompañada hace 14 años con el señor Neri quien trabaja de chofer en un línea de transporte, tienen dos hijos menores de edad que van a la escuela. La señora Mirtha se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado aportar en los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes esenciales para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos en general, panificados y otros. Está muy agradecida a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que esta le da
texts.en:
The current communal bank is formed thanks to one of the members' contacts. She organized her friends and colleagues with the intention of helping one another. They are all working women, determined and above all else united.

Sra. Mirtha is one of the members. She has had a partner, Señor Neri, for the last 14 years who works as a driver for a transport company. They have 2 children, minors, who attend school. Señora Mirtha sells all kinds of food. She tells us that thanks to this work she has managed to contribute to the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients esential for the food she makes such as meat, chicken, seasonings in general, pastries and other. She is very grateful to the Fundacion and to Kiva for the help given.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, seasonings in general and pastries and other things.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 34 years old and married with six children. For many years, she has planted, harvested, and sold taro. Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this will be her fourth loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Elisapeta is requesting a 1250 WST loan to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 400 WST or 167 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Rosemarie has a retail shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Rosemarie is a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and has seven children. Thelma is married. Two of her children are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Parch

texts.en:
Parch, 42 years old, is a farmer and earns $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day. They have two children, one is a construction worker and earns $2 per day, and the other one is staying home. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $4 on electricity, $3 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy yam wholesale to resell. She wants to buy a car that she can rent to the villagers and to transport yam to sell so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy yam wholesale to resell

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en:
Suitupe is 43 years old and married with three children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a bakery and she sells baked goods in her local community. Suitupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and this will be her fifth loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Suitupe is requesting a 2,500 WST loan to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 800 WST or 333 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 37 years old, is working in a garment factory with her husband and each earns $3 per day. The couple has two children, both are working in the factory and each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on rental fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy coal to sell. The loan will help her family to have a new career that can earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy coal to sell

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en:
Isapela is 36 years old and married with four children. For the past three years, she has owned and operated a business planting, harvesting, and selling fruits and vegetables. Isapela joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services and this will be her third loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Isapela is requesting a 1,800 WST loan to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 300 WST or 125 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Adelfa has a shop that sells jewelry like bracelets, necklaces and earrings. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.

Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Adelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 48 years old, is a pig feeder and earns $2 per day. Her husband is a rubber tree seller and earns $15 per day. They have two children, both are working and each earns $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $109 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy pig food to feed them so they sell. She wants to feed more pigs at home so she can make better income.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Marta quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras y de esa forma poder superar los obstáculos que diariamente surgen.
La señora Marta, está separada hace 2 años, tiene cinco hijos, 4 menores de edad y uno mayor.  La señora Marta se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata. Comenta que este es su medio de producir ingresos y la forma en que ayuda a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que lucha por el bienestar de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas en plata, para que de esa forma pueda tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues la ayuda será muy importante para su micronegocio.
texts.en:
The contact for the start of the current communal bank was Señora Marta who invited and organized her friends to form a part of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación. They came together with the intention of helping each other and in this way overcoming the obstacles that arise daily.

Señora Marta, separated for 2 years, has 5 chidren, 4 minors and 1 adult. Señora Marta sells silver jewelry. She tells us that this is her way of making an income and helping her family. She describes herself as a very hardworking and selfsacrificing woman who fights for the well-being of her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy silver jewelry so that she can offer her customers more variety. She is thankful to the Fundacion for the opportunity they give her as the help will be very important for her small business.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Dagdulam

texts.en:
Dagdulam is 37 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is a single mother and her daughter is a student. Since 2009, Dagdulam has been a certified sewer who runs a tailoring business. In 2010, she began sewing ger coverings and curtains. Dagdulam’s skills are well-known around her neighborhood. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "It is hard to run a business for a single mom, however I will not rest until my daughter graduates college." 

Dagdulam is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.use: to purchase material

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 1 child. 

Cherly has a shop that sells recycled materials like plastics, bottles and metals. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics.

Cherly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cherly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun, 33 years old, sells groceries and gas in front of her house, and earns $2 per day. Her husband sells salt and earns $3 per day. They have three childrE., two are studying and one more is too small to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $3 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy salt to sell. She wants to opE. a grocery store in front of her home bigger than the one she has now, and will sell more kinds of grocery goods so that she can make better income.

loans.use: To buy salt to sell

loans.name: Tulaumu

texts.en:
Tulaumu is 49 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a business making and selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). Tulaumu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  

Tulaumu is requesting a 1500 WST loan to purchase an extra sewing machine. She plans to use the profit from her loan (estimated to be 300 WST or 125 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an extra sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products such as bath soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and other kitchen needs to sell

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Trabajadoras de Santa Rosa” está iniciándose en el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Todas ellas se esfuerzan día a día para el bienestar de sus familias, para que estas tengan un futuro mejor y distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir.
Una de las miembros es la señora Nilde, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas de todo tipo. Comenta que siempre tiene pedidos para todo tipo de eventos, como ser fiestas de cumpleaños, de 15 años y demás. Dice que le gustaría poder seguir con el trabajo que hace, pues le gusta mucho. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levaduras y demás con lo cual podrá tener suficientes ingredientes para cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Las Trabajadoras de Santa Rosa” (The Working Women of Santa Rosa) is starting in the Women Entrepreneurs Program of Fundación Paraguaya. All of the members already engage in productive business activities and strive every day to provide for the welfare of their families and have a future that is better than what they experienced previously.

One of the members is Sra. Nilde who sells all types of cakes. She says that she receives orders for all types of events such as birthdays, quinceañeras, and other occasions. Nilde says that she would like to continue her work because she enjoys it so much. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other supplies so that she will have enough ingredients to complete the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other supplies.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 34 years of age and married. She has two children. 

Akenese owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro (a potato-like tuber) for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Akenese needs a loan of WST $1,450 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Akenese's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Lydia provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures. Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Myagmarjav is 31 years old and lives with his his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sews at home, his elder son studies at school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

He was a herder in a remote area until 2009. Then he sold all of his livestock and moved to the center of the province. In the 2009, he built his own home and bought a car to run a taxi service. 

He needs to repair his car and at the same time his wife needs raw materials to expand her business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I was scared to move at first, but now it is not scary at all. I see opportunities." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair his car and to buy a sewing materials for his wife.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the taxi and sewing materials for his wife.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal, 33 years old, is a house wife. Her husband is a worker and earns $6 per day. The couple has two children, one is studying and one more is working in a restaurant and earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $105 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer for her yam plantation. She wants to sell grocery goods in front of her house when she can save enough money to start.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her yam plantation

loans.name: Anapogi

texts.en:
Anapogi is 32 years of age and married. She has three children. 

Anapogi works in her business, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Anapogi needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase an extra fishing net and fishing equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Anapogi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Anapogi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an extra fishing net and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. Florita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Florita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Juan 2”se formó gracias al deseo de superación y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus integrantes .La mayor parte de sus integrantes ya realiza una actividad productiva.  Todas ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación.
Una de ellas es la señora Geronima, la cual se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, abrigos, medias y demás. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada, la cual compra de ella sus ropas, pues ella siempre trae cosas muy novedosas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, abrigos, media y demás con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad de prendas que mostrar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Juan 2” was formed as a result of its members and their desire to succeed and improve their quality of life. Most of them engage in productive business activities. They all want a better future for their children, so they double their efforts to obtain what they need to develop and grow.

One of the members is Sra. Geronima. She sells clothing of all types such as trousers, shirts, t-shirts, coats, stockings, and other items. Geronima says that she has a well-established customer base who buy clothes from her, so she always tries to offer products that are up-to-date.

She is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, coats, stockings, and other items so that her business will have a greater variety of clothes that she can show to her customers.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, coats, stockings, and other items.

loans.name: Cresbee

texts.en:
Cresbee is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cresbee has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Cresbee has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is from the city of Maquilao, Tangub City, Philippines. She is a widow with five siblings. To supply their daily needs, Procora owns and manage a sari-sari (variety) store. In this type of work, she earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month and been in this job for almost 10 years. 

Because she needs to purchase more products for her sari-sari store, Procora requests a loan of 15,000 PHP.

Procora has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to gain more income in order for her to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Rebecca has a variety store, or "sari-sari" store, which sells items like powdered coffee, milk, sugar, biscuits, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items for daily use like shampoo, toothpaste, and bath soap. She has had this business for three years. Rebecca has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock for her store.

Rebecca joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for selling like coffee, milk, sugar, biscuits, and canned goods.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Avelina has a retail shop that sells fish, such as sardines and salmon. She has had this business for 10 years. Avelina has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell in her store.

Avelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
15 Señoras muy trabajadoras se unieron para formar un grupo; un comité solidario en donD. el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espíritu emprendedor, las mismas residen en la ciudad D. Caaguazú, actualmente están en el ciclo numero 10 y quieren seguir progresando todas juntas.
Una D. ellas es la señora Miryan, ella se dedica a la venta D. perfumes, tanto para hombres, como para mujeres. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes, por lo que su negocio le trae buenas ganancias. Así también dice que al igual también tiene tiempos duros, pero pese a ello siempre está optimista.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar perfumes, tanto como para mujeres y caballeros, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere cumplir con ellos para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen hardworking women have joined together to form this group. This committee has promised to work together. The key to their success is their entrepreneurial spirit. They all resiD. in the city of Caaguazú and are currently in their 10th loan cycle. In addition, they hope to continue progressing together as a group.

One of the members is Sra. Miryan who sells perfumes for men and women. She says that she has many customers, which is why her business generates good earnings. Miryan says that she also has experienced hard times like everyone else, but despite the situation she has always remained optimistic.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes for women and men. Miryan already has many orders, so she wants to fulfill all of them in order to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 37 years of age and married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Telesia needs a loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Telesia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed, with eight children. 

Rebecca has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her shop.

Rebecca is a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en:
Lemapu is 42 years of age and married with six children. He owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. He has many years of experience in this business. 

Lemapu needs a loan of 1250 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. He plans to use the profit from his business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lemapu  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lemapu's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La Sra. Sixta está casada con Gilberto, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 están en la Argentina trabajando y los restantes aún son menores que son el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, por los que procura siempre para poder darles lo mejor. 
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. Una de sus hija mayor -tiene 16 años y le ayuda en con las tareas en la despensa. Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que había juntado con el trabajo que realiza su marido, el cual  trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada en el centro de la Ciudad para que de esa manera pueda ayudarla con los gastos del hogar. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres con los cuales podrá llenar su negocio, como ser lácteos, cárnicos, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Sixta is married to Gilberto. They have five children, two of whom work in Argentina while the others are still under their care. For this reason, Sixta strives every day to always provide the best for her family. She manages a well-stocked food pantry that is recognized in her neighborhood. One of her daughters, age 16, helps with tasks related to her business. They have been able to push forward with the little bit of profit from her food pantry and the income from her husband’s job. He is employed at a private company in the central part of the city, so he is able to help with the household expenses.

Sixta is determined, honest, well-known, and respected by everyone who lives in the neighborhood. She is requesting a loan to buy provisions to stock her business such as dairy products, meats, baked goods, and other items.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meats, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en:
Perenise is 30 years of age and married with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Perenise needs a loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Perenise joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Perenise's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Analee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Analee is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Elvio Roberto

texts.es:
El  Señor Elvio está casado, tiene 4  hijos,  todos ellos en edad escolar. El  se dedica a la venta de Zapatos Usados,  en su domicilio.
El comenta que en su negocio le va muy bien por lo que tiene muchos clientes y eso le genera muy buenos ingresos. Dice que todo lo que hace es por darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ya que el tuvo que pasar por muchas privaciones y no quiere que sus hijos pasen por lo mismo.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Hoy día el es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano, para la posterior venta, ya que de esa forma podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Elvio is married and has four children who are all of school age. He sells used shoes from his home.

Elvio says that his business is doing very well because he has many customers and can generate a very good income. Everything he does is intended to provide a better future for his children. Since he had to endure many hardships, he does not want his children to have the same experience.

With the help of his wife, Elvio is able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication. Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur who has many customers because of the good service he provides. Elvio has demonstrated that he is a responsible and honest person in all of his commitments, so he is worthy of everyone’s support. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy secondhand shoes for eventual resale. This will allow him to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for eventual resale.

loans.name: Aunofo

texts.en:
Aunofo is 62 years of age and married with eight children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Aunofo needs a loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Aunofo joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aunofo's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 30 years old. She is married and has three children.

Annabel is engaged in food peddling. She cooks snack food like the "banana cue" and goes from house to house to sell her product. She has had this business for three years.

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional ingredients for her "banana cue" like cooking oil, sugar and bananas.

Annabel joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients used in making native snack food like "banana cue," which is intended for sale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La  señora Eugenia, es D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene una despensa bien surtida, el cual es su local propio. Ella vive en su casa propia. Comenta que cuenta con clientela bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro, pues hace 7 años que está trabajando en el mismo ramo, anteriormente tenia un comedor parrillada, pero quedo viuda y cambio D. trabajo. Tiene buena referencia comercial y financiera.
Ella se define como una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que pese a todos los problemas y contratiempos ha logrado salir adelante y ser una buena comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas, cárnicos, embutidos, lácteos y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y llenar su negocio con productos que diariamente se venden.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She has her own location where she manages a well-stocked food pantry. Eugenia lives in her own home. She says that she has an established customer base because of her seven years of experience in this line of work. Eugenia previously managed a diner where she sold grilled foods, but she changed businesses after she became a widow. She has good business and credit references.

Eugenia defines herself as an enterprising and determined woman. Despite all of the problems and setbacks she has faced, Eugenia has been able to move forward and become a good businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, meats, sausages, dairy products, and other items so that her business will be stocked and filled with merchandise that she can sell on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meats, sausages, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Lilipeta

texts.en:
Lilipeta is 28 years old and is married with one child. Lilipeta owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Lilipeta needs a loan of WST 1200 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Lilipeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lilipeta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Eramo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eramo tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Selva de 39 años de edad,  ellos llevan 20 años de casados y tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos.
El Sr. Eramo se dedica a la compra – venta de chatarras, baterías viejas que posteriormente los vuelve a vender a recicladoras de la zona. Don Eramo cuenta que su hijo mayor que lo ayuda con su trabajo día a día y tiene como anhelo la de formar para su propia recicladora ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro y va a poder desenvolverse sin ningún problema en esa actividad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de chatarras y baterías viejas ya que cuenta con una venta segura con las recicladoras y desea aumentar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Eramo, 39, is married to Selva, 39.  They have been married for 20 years and have the good fortune of having three children.

Eramo buys and sells scrap and old batteries that later he resells to recycling plants in the area.  Eramo's oldest son helps him with his work every day.  His desire is to start his own recycling company, since he has experience in this area and will be able to perform the job without any problem.

He is requesting the loan to buy scrap and old batteries, since he has certain sales with the recycling businesses and he wants to increase his stock of products.

loans.use: to buy scrap and old batteries to sell

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is 29 years old and is married with three children. Lesina owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Lesina needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Lesina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lesina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses.

loans.name: Bebiano

texts.en: Bebiano is married and has 10 children. He is 54 years old and is a resident of Pan-taon, Ozamis City, in the Philippines. For his income, Bebiano owns and operates land where he farms vegetables and rice. Every month, he earns 10,000 and he has had this business for 30 years. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Bebiano has been a member of GDMPC for three years. Bebiano's plan is to finish his children's studies and improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old and married. She has four children and lives in Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Carmen owns a piggery and sells swine to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP per month. 

Carmen requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more swine for her piggery.
 
Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Carmen's future plan is to expand her swine business and to support the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more swine for her piggery.

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en:
Tiaina is 21 years of age and single with no children. 

Tiaina owns and operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Tiaina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Tiaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tiaina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nidia Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Nidia tiene 45 años D. edad, está casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad D. Itá. Tiene un taller D. costura en su domicilio hace más D. 12 años, su marido trabaja en una empresa como chofer hace ya como 27 años. Ambos ayudan en los ingresos del hogar y gracias al trabajo en conjunto salen adelante.
Nidia es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y dedicada a sus hijos, ella cuenta que gracias a los préstamos que le otorgo la fundación creció y se formo en su microempresa. Ella tiene como objetivo que la empresa sea reconocida a nivel local ya que esto le ayudará a formarse como empresaria y aumentara el nivel económico D. ella y su familia.
Solicita la ayuda D. la fundación para la compra D. telas, el cual es el elemento indispensable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nidia is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Itá. Nidia has operated a sewing workshop in her home for more than 12 years. Her husband has worked for a company as a chauffeur for 27 years. Both of them help one another with the household expenses and they have been able to move forward because of their work.

Nidia is a hardworking and responsible woman who is dedicated to her children. She says that the loans from Fundación Paraguaya have helped her to grow and develop into a micro-entrepreneur. Nidia indicates that the goal for her business is to be recognized on a local level. This will help her become established as a businesswoman and increase the financial standing for herself and her family.

Nidia is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy fabric, an indispensable product for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Nasareta

texts.en:
Nasareta is 28 years of age and married. She has three children. 

Nasareta owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Nasareta needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Nasareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nasareta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients in cooking different viand, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
El Sr. Casimiro tiene 57 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y trabajador, está casado con la Sra. Eulalia hace 27 años, tienen dos hijos juntos: Ramona de 26 años y José de 25 años, viven en esa ciudad hace mas de 11 años.
El Sr. Casimiro se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas hace mas de 20 años, vivía en la ciudad de Villarrica y luego por cuestiones familiares se mudó a la ciudad de Itá, tiene su puesto de venta en la vereda de una clínica en el centro mismo de la ciudad, un lugar muy transitado donde pudo formar su clientela, ya que con lluvia, frio o mucho calor el permanece en su puesto fiel a sus clientes. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque no tiene la infraestructura necesaria para soportar algunos climas pero que le encanta su trabajo. Su sueño es tener un puesto digno y confortable dentro del Mercado Municipal de la ciudad y que cree que va a ser a corto plazo.
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de de bananas, manzanas, naranjas los cuales son productos esenciales de su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Casimiro, age 57, is a humble and hardworking gentleman. He has been married to Sra. Eulalia for 27 years. They have two children, Ramona (age 26) and José (age 25). Casimiro and his family have lived in this city for more than 11 years.

He has been in the business of buying and selling fruit for more than 20 years. Casimiro lived in the city of Villarrica before moving to the city of Itá for family reasons. His vending post is set up on the sidewalk near a clinic in the central part of the city. This very place is where he established his customer base. He makes himself available to his customers by managing his business through rain, cold and heat. Casimiro says that his work requires great sacrifice since he does not have the necessary infrastructure to endure certain weather conditions, but he enjoys what he does. His dream is to have a decent and comfortable stand at the municipal market. He believes that he can accomplish this in the short term.

Casimiro is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy bananas, apples, and oranges since these products are essential to his business. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for being given this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, oranges, and other fruits.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Emilia has a shop that sells motorcycle, or habal-habal, services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 42 years old, married, and has four siblings. 

To make a living, Ellen buys and sells banana products. Ellen has been in her business for two years and she earns 20,000 PHP per month from this work.

For almost a year, Ellen is been a member of GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fruits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and expand her buy and sell business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Wilma Vicenta

texts.es:
Se trata de una persona joven, soltera sin hijos que estudia y trabaja en un Hospedaje y en una Despensa, vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Pilar y es oriunda del interior específicamente de San Juan de Ñeembucu donde están sus padres que son agricultor y ganaderos.
Está cursando actualmente el primer año de la carrera de Enfermería de la Facultad. Ella comenta que su mayor anhelo es poder ayudar a las personas por medio de su trabajo, es por ello que se esfuerza diariamente.
Solicita el crédito para el pago de materiales y cuotas de sus estudios para poder rendir sus exámenes finales. Ella está muy agradecida a la institución por la oportunidad que le da por poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
This is about a young, single, childless young woman who studies and works at an inn and at a store.  She lives in a rented house in the city of Pilar.  

She’s from the interior of the country, specifically from San Juan de Ñeembucu which is where her parents, who are farmers and raise livestock, live.

She is currently in first year of Applied Nursing.  She comments that her greatest wish is to be able to help people through her work and this is why she puts such an effort in daily.

She asked for the loan to pay for supplies and fees in order to present her final exams.  She is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity it gives her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Zunilda Ester

texts.es:
La señora Zunilda es soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Curuguaty. Es comerciante, cuenta con un Kiosco,  que está ubicado dentro del Salón de la Terminal de Ómnibus de Curuguaty. Dice que tiene  2 años de antigüedad y experiencia en el ramo.
Ella comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas del día para abrir su kiosko, ya que en la terminal siempre hay gente circulando. Dice que le va muy bien en las ventas y que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que  solicita el crédito para la compra de un congelador, que le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio, pues necesita mantener frías las bebidas que vende. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad de progreso que le está dando, pues esto le serás de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Zunilda is 28 years old, single, and lives in the city of Curuguaty. She is a merchant who manages a kiosk inside the hall of the bus terminal in Curuguaty. Zunilda says that she has been in business for two years and has experience in this type of work.

She says that she wakes up very early in order to open her kiosk since there are always people walking around the bus terminal. Zunilda indicates that she has done very well with her sales and would like to continue with her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a freezer because it will be a great help in her business since she needs to chill the beverages that she sells. Zunilda is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for giving her this opportunity to make progress, which will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for chilling beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, a 41-year-old married mother of two, resides in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has been operating a buy-and-sell business with dried fish selling for five years, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000. A member of GDMPC for a year, Gemma has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional dried fish to sell. In the future, she wants to build a big house and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is 53 years old. She is married and has six adult children.

Josephina has a "sari-sari", or variety, store which sells different food items such as biscuits, bread, junk food and chips. She has had this business for five years.

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock for her variety store like additional biscuits, junk food and chips, as well powdered juice drinks.

Josephina joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food items such as biscuits, junk food, bread and powdered juice drinks, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Luisa, ella tiene un copetín (lugar de venta de comidas) en el cual trabaja desde hace un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela. Comenta que tiene clientes que siempre acuden hasta su local para la compra de los alimentos que vende.
Ella pide la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
The committee named “Maria Auxiliadora” was formed by several neighbors joining together from the city of Santaní. All of the members of this committee have developed independent business activities. They have formed a very close group that is capable of working together in activities that strengthen their friendships.

One of the members is Sra. Luisa. She has a snack bar that she has managed for some time and has built up a customer base. Luisa says that customers always come to her establishment to buy the food that she sells.

She is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy needed supplies for preparing the dishes that she sells such as meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Marife has a shop that sells clothing like T-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing like T-shirts, blouses and underwear for sale.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like T-shirts, blouses and underwear for sale.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child.
 
Shirly has a shop that sells fish, like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her shop.

Shirly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Elena is engaged in cooking different viands (dishes) and going around her neighborhood in order to sell them. She has had this business for five years. 

Elena has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more ingredients to use in cooking various dishes, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, spices, and other cooking condiments.

Elena joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to use in cooking viands for sale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Rachel has a shop that makes and sells sleeping pillows. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 26,000 to buy materials she needs for making her pillows, like cottons and cloth.

Rachel has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rachel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making pillows, like cottons and cloth.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Virginia has a shop that sells fish, like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Medie has a shop that makes and sells charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy wood and coconut shells for making charcoal.

Medie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Medie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: John Mark

texts.en: John Mark is married. He is 24 years old and resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. John Mark owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting mangos for sale. The mango tree is behind him, he sprayed it with a pesticides for flowering. John Mark sprayed also pesticides to kill the insects for the flowers not to die. so that it will bear a good fruit. He has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 4,420 PHP a month.John Mark is requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase pesticides for the better growth and for the mangoes to produce good quality. John Mark's future plan to renovate his house for better living and make his mango farm bigger.

loans.use: to purchase flowering pesticides and for the insects

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Antonieta has a variety store or "sari-sari store," which sells products for daily kitchen use, like cooking oil, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, spices, and packed, powdered seasonings.  She also sells bathing needs like shampoo and conditioner. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more cooking oil, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, spices, powdered seasonings, shampoo, and conditioner for her store. Antonieta joined as a member of HSPFI in 2011; in the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her "sari-sari" (variety) store, such as cooking oil, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, and other spices, packed, powdered seasonings, and daily bathing items like shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosalinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Rosalinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Luyến is a 35-year-old woman living in a town in Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Luyến owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling second-hand goods for local businesses and community members.  Luyến has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Luyến joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luyến has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,184,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase scrap metal to sell.  Luyến is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.  This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Luyến plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Luyến là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Luyến Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở hàng cũ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Luyến thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Luyến kiếm được khoảng 8.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Luyến đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Luyến đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Luyến dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Suchet

texts.en:
Suchet is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Suchet has a "sari-sari" store or a variety store that sells snack items like biscuits, cookies, soda crackers, junk food, and bottled soda drinks.  She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snack items and beverages for her store.

Suchet joined as member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snack items like biscuits, soda crackers, cookies, junk food, and bottled soda drinks, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Более трех лет Диловар занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Он покупает скот из местных рынках, затем откармливает их в течении определенный период а потом продает на выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит хороший прибыль. Диловар хотел бы получит займ в размере 1250$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Dilovar is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Dilovar has been involved in fattening up cattle for over three years.  He buys livestock from local markets, then fattens it up over a set period of time and then sells it at a profitable price.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Dilovar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1250 for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 60 years old; married with seven kids, and residing at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Remegia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Remegia engaged this type of business to help her husband in having a good return of income for her family. As a result, she was able to earn 2000 Php a month.

Remegia requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional product to resell. She's been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Remegia plans to improve their house so as to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to resell

loans.name: Gulbara's Group

texts.en:
Gulbara is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up five children. The youngest daughter is just two years old; the older son works in Russia, the second son is a farmer, and the other two children study at school. 

In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, Gulbara breeds livestock and resells it after fattening. In this way she earns about 4000 soms per month. She has been running a livestock breeding business for twenty years; she started it after the birth of the older son. With money received from the loan, Gulbara wants to purchase hay to feed their livestock during the winter season. In the future she wants to see her older son get wed, Gulbara also plans to build a house for him.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 44 years old. She is married and has seven children. 

Encarnacion has a "sari-sari" store or variety store which sells food items like canned goods, bread, and junk food. Aside from the food items, Encarnacion also sells fresh fish by the kilo. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Encarnacion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fresh fish and food items like canned goods, bread, and junk food.  Encarnacion joined as a  member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items like bread, junk food, canned goods and fresh fish, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Mamlakatjon

texts.ru: Мамлакатджон вдова и у него двое детей. Она умная и целеустремленная женщина. Чтобы содержать свою семью и обеспечить своих детей она начала заниматься купля продажей женских одежд 16 лет назад. В этом бизнесе она имеет богатый опыт и успешно продолжает. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль для того чтобы устроит свадьбу внука. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента женских одежд с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mamlakatjon is a widow with two children.  She is a smart and goal-oriented woman. In order to support her family and provide for her children, 16 years ago she started buying and reselling women’s clothing. She has a lot of experience in this business and continues doing it successfully. She would like to expand her business and maximize her profit in order to pay for her grandson’s wedding. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 3000 TJS in order to buy a new assortment of women’s clothing and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy goods [women's clothing]

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca, 42, is married and lives in Kasese, Uganda in her own house. Rabecca is the mother of five children. 

She operates a retail drug shop, a business she has been in for three years. Her major hardship is lack of equipment to enable her drug shop to make it to the next level, where she can treat patients based on tests carried out. She says she hopes to achieve that feat in the near future. Rabecca needs the loan to buy human drugs for selling at her shop.

Rabecca is working hard to ensure her children go to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy human drugs for selling at her drug shop.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr's Group

texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old and divorced. She is bringing up two children by herself: her daughter studies at school and her son is a baby. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 7,000 soms, Gulkaiyr started to take orders for sewing clothes, pillows and blankets. In this way she earns money to meet her family’s needs. Her monthly profit is about 15,000 soms.
  
At the moment, Gulkaiyr’s business runs well and she plans to open a sewing workshop. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase sewing machines for the sewing workshop. 

In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett, 31, is married and has four children, two of whom are already in school. He has been in farming for eight years and currently employs one farmhand. He produces tea and milk for the local market. He also works as a tailor for additional income.

Bett has requested for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his dairy business by buying an additional dairy cow. He says the extra income will help alleviate the family’s challenges in providing basic needs, especially for the children.

He adds that access to finances is the main challenge to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi, 47, lives in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Thi owns and operates a business raising livestock.  The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Thi has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Thi joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thi is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  This loan will be the first taken out by Thi from SEDA.  Thi plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
