Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thi là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Thi Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Thi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thi kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Thi đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thi đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Thi dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Botirbek

texts.ru: Ботырбек проживает в городе Сарбанд. Возраст, 54 года. Женат. У него 11 детей. Он предоставляет услугу, развозит людей по маршруту Сарбанд-Кургантюбе. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения микроавтобуса марки "Хюндай-старекс".
texts.en: Botirbek lives in the town of Sarband.  He is 54 years old, married and has 11 children.  He provides a service and transports people along the Sarband-Qurgan-Tube route.  He has been in this business for five years.  Botirbek is requesting this loan for the purchase of a Hyundai Starex minivan.

loans.use: to purchase a Hyundai Starex minivan

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 39 years old and illiterate. Her parents could not provide her with an education due to financial constraints. 

Rukhsana is married and her husband operates a grocery store in their home, selling daily-use items like spices, sugar, cooking oils, etc. Rukhsana is the mother of a young son who also works. 

Rukhsana provides support to her husband in her free time. She helps him operate his grocery store and serves his clients. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who, with the help of the loan, will purchase groceries in bulk, which will allow him to fulfill client orders on time and increase his profits. 

Rukhsana's husband has been operating his business for 10 years, and Rukhsana is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost dairy business, construct a green house and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Musalam

texts.ru: Мусалам разведена и любящая мать троих детей. Ей одному тяжело содержать свою семью и обеспечить своих детей. Более 8 лет она занимается купля продажей одежды и обуви. Мусалам хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы могла обеспечить своих детей и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 12000 Сомони для покупки зимней одежды и обуви.
texts.en: Musalam is divorced and is a loving mother of three children. It is hard for her alone to support the family and provide for her children. For more than eight years she has been buying and selling shoes. Musalam wants to expand her business so that she could provide better for her children and improve the conditions they live in. She wants to get a loan in the amount of 12000 somoni to buy winter clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nhuận

texts.en:
N. is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 4 adult -age children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.   The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.736.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui has used her loan usefully and this time she needs to renew her broken nail-machine and make some adjustments to her workshop.

loans.use: To renew her broken nail-machine and make some adjustments to her workshop.

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Chebet is age 28, single with one child aged 5. She has been in the farming business for 8 years and currently produces tea and milk for the local market.

Chebet has made a loan request to Juhudi Kilimo amounting to  30,000 KES to enable her  buy a chaff cutter for her dairy farm. (A chaff cutter is a mechanical device for cutting straw or hay into small pieces — before being mixed together with other forage and fed to horses and cattle. This aids the animal's digestion and prevents animals from rejecting any part of their food.)

Chebet says this will ease the feeding of  her dairy cows and reduce waste  incurred when the dairy animals are fed without cutting the feeds to size. She hopes she will be able to double her milk output and give better care to her child.

Chebet laments the dry conditions which affect the productivity of both the dairy and tea businesses.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en: Gegham trades in furniture. He has been managing the business successfully for three years already, and would now like to expand his enterprise and trade in carpets and clothing, too. These products have been in high demand lately, so expanding his business will mean an increase of working capital for Gegham. This loan will help him get additional income and insure better living conditions for his family in the future. He lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase carpets and clothing for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is age 41 and has been practicing mixed farming in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for 25 years. Her farm currently produces maize, milk beans and eggs which she sells to the local markets. She operates a hotel in the local market too for additional income.

Jacinta has requested for a loan of 42,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow for her dairy business. She says the income will help enable her improve the living standards of her family. She aspires to buy more land and construct a good residential house for her family.

Jacinta mentions the high cost of farm inputs as a major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Fely

texts.en:
Maria Fely is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She has a stall at the market where she sells the meat of pigs she has butchered. She has had this business for five years. 

Maria Fely has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more pigs to be butchered.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to be butchered.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Мафтуна живет вместе с родителями. Раньше Мафтуна помогала маме в торговле, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется свой бизнес. Она занимается торговлей на рынке, в основном продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Matfuna lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 20 years old and not married.  Matfuna lives together with her parents.  Previously, she helped her mother with sales and today has her own business.  She is involved in sales at the market and primarily sells fruits.  Matfuna is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 32 years old and married with two children. Arturo is a farmer. He operates his farm to earn their living. Every month he earns 16,000 PHP from this work and has had this work for three years. Arturo requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Arturo has been a member for a year in GDMPC. His plan is to have his own house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred has been  a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya for five years running, with his farming producing milk and eggs for the local markets. He is aged 36 and married with five children aged between 13 and 5 years.

Fred has made a loan request of 36,400 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will generate more income and enable the family to acquire more assets. He aspires to own five dairy cows of better quality and to be the main milk suppler in the area.

He says animal diseases are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. She has a rented stall at the market where she sells different kinds of vegetables, spices, and the usual cooking condiments like vinegar, soy sauce, and powdered seasonings. She has had this business for seven  years. 

Lucia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables, spices, and cooking condiments.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, spices, and cooking condiments for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 8 and 17.  She has been in farming for 11 years, producing and selling vegetables, tomatoes and bananas at the local market. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds so she can venture into poultry farming. She has plans to have a farm running with 2000 birds in two years. She says there is a ready market for both birds and eggs, and the business will generate more income to help provide for the family’s basic needs.  She is aware of the main pitfall of the business – animal diseases – but despite this challenge, she remains focused on achieving success and repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Manzurakhon

texts.ru: Манзурахон жительница города Исфара. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает национальные платья и ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Manzurakhon is a resident of the town of Isfara.  She is 33 years old, married and has one child.  She leases a retail outlet at the market, where she sells national dresses and fabrics.  Manzurakhon has been involved in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. She is in the business of buying used clothing ("ukay-ukay") and selling it in a retail setting.  Some of the used clothing, like gowns, is intended to be rented out. She has had this business for three years. 

Jenelyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more used clothing to sell or rent.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell or rent.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 11 years. 

Merriam has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Раънохон вдова. Имеет одного ребенка. Для содержания семьи она работает на рынке. Её предпринимательская  деятельность имеет 21 летний стаж. Она торгует промтоварами: полотенце, скатерти, покрывала. Содержать семью одной очень тяжело вся работа на ее плечах и уход за домом, и плата всех коммунальных  услуг, и обучение, и  содержание семьи. Она старается содержать семью так, чтобы ребенок не почувствовал  отсутствие отца. Она хочет получить займ в размере 3500 Сомони. Для увеличения товарооборота и расширения ассортимента товаров. Она надеется получить займ и на вашу доброту. Она благодарна вам.
texts.en: Ranokhon is a widow. She has one child. She works on the market to support the family. Her experience in business is 21 years. She sells household goods such as towels, tablecloth, bed covers. It's hard to support the family by herself and all the housework work is laid on her shoulders, as wells as utility bills, children's eduction and other family expenses. She tries to provide for the family so that the child does not feel the absence of the father. She wants to get a loan in the amount of 3500 somoni to increase the commodity circulation and expand the variety of the goods. She hopes to get the loan and for your kindness. She is grateful to all of you.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with the goal to increase commodity circulation and expand the variety of goods

loans.name: Elyna

texts.en:
Elyna is a married woman with four children and she is 54 years old. Elyna comes from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elyna's source of income is the operation of motorcycle transport. From this job, she earn 35,000 PHP per month and she has been in this job for 15 years. 

Elyna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for the better functioning of her motorcycle. Elyna has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to become more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the better functioning of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children. He has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Natasha & Boardwalk. He has had this business for 5 years. 

Ronie has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more stock for his store.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store from Natasha & Boardwalk.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

Jovita has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is 38 years old and has been in mixed farming for over eight years. Her produce of maize, milk, eggs and beans currently go to the local markets. She is married with six children between two and sixteen years old. She currently employs two farmhands.

Margaret has requested a loan for 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the boost in dairy farming will help her retain business and improve her family's living standards significantly.

She is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans are enabling farmers buy better breeds of dairy cows. She notes, however, that food shortages and animal diseases are major challenges.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from the village of Kisiskhevi in the Kakheti region. She is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband (Nikoloz), and two sons (16 and 13 years old). Her children go to school. Manana and Nikoloz earn a living through family agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf. Their dairy products are sold locally. Along with the dairy, they have three pigs and sell on average 30 piglets per year. Their family's total average monthly income is 450 Georgian Laris. 

Manana requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. She will sell more dairy products in the village. It will increase her family's income, which will be used for to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Eulilia

texts.en:
Eulilia is 60 years old. She is married and has three adult children. 

Eulilia has a variety store or so-called "sari-sari" store that sells food items, beverages, and daily-use products. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock for her "sari-sari" store, like canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, chocolate drink, bottled beverages, and daily-use products such as shampoo and toothpaste.

Eulilia joined as a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, powdered coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, bottled beverages, and other daily-use products like shampoo and toothpaste, all of which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 32 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his glass store, which sells cups, home decorations and other glassware. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies for glass making and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for glass making

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from the village of Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old. Rita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. 

Rita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. Rita is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and expand her business.

She's been a member of GDMPC for seven years. Rita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and expand her business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 30 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Frank has been working hard to manage his hardware shop, which sells tools and machines. 

To help expand his business, Frank is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which he will use to purchase hardware tools his customers have been asking for.  This loan will help Frank to generate greater profits and fill his store to capacity. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to establish another business. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase the hardware tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло проживает в районе Восеъ. Он женат. Ему 34 года. У них пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хайрулло предоставляет услугу. В основном он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кроме того он занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этой области Хайрулло 15 лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей.
texts.en: Khayrullo lives in the Vose district.  He is 34 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khayrullo provides a service.  He primarily provides a taxi service and is also involved in auto repair.  Khayrullo has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana, a 41-year-old married mother of three children, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a sari-sari store in the Philippines for nine years, she also earns an income from selling coconut wine and eggs.

Feliciana has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one for PHP 15,000 to buy more store goods to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more store stocks to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by selling veterinary products in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Analyn has been selling veterinary products for 5 years and also earns additional income from a meat shop and retail sales of animal feed and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 57 years old and married with 8 children.

Jelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jelita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 34 years and also earns an income from pig raising.

Jelita aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Silveria makes and sells snacks like rice, cheese & pancakes . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks .
Silveria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Silveria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 44 years old and married with 6 children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a cellphone accessories store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the cellphone accessories store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelita is 34 years old and has 6 children who are in school.

Amelita has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle.

Amelita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 55 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Fredrick has been working hard to manage his small stall, where he sells spare mechanical parts for motorbikes and cars. 

To help expand his business, Fredrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale, and will help Fredrick to generate greater profits and to pay his children's school fees on time. Fredrick hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business until he has the biggest spare parts stall in Luwero. 

Fredrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fredrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and is married to a welder. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters.  The daughters are employed; the older one is a bookkeeper, and the younger one is in obstetrics. Her older son works in Russia, and her younger son is a soldier. In order to earn money, Tamara breeds cattle. She has been running a cattle breeding business since 1985, with which her husband helps her. At the moment they have a cow, five calves, and six sheep. With this loan, Tamara plans to purchase four calves to increase her number of cattle. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development, and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four calves for breeding.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Ozamis City, Philippines. She is 58 years old, is married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a business venture in the construction sector, selling items such as bricks. Carmen has been in this business for over ten years and earns 25,000 PHP per month from these activities. Carmen is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more construction supplies. 
Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for four years. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Elezar

texts.en:
Elizar is 54 years old. He is married and has two children. 

Elizar is in the business of buying recycled materials like plastic bottles, scrap metals, and other scrap materials. He buys these per kilo and sells them to buyers who buy them per kilo. He has had this business for three years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy more scrap materials.

Elizar joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional recycled materials like empty bottles and other scrap metals. These scrap materials are intended for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 70 лет. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. У него средне - специальное образование. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он 15 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Davron lives in the Vose district.  He is 70 years old, married and has 8 children.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  Davron provides a taxi service and has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is married to Judy, and together they have two children who both attend school. He own a retail kiosk, and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 80,000 from the business.

This is his first loan from KADET. He will this loan to purchase cereals, cooking oil, and soap .

Benard will use his anticipated profit to install electricity in his home. His dream is to expand his kiosk to sell goods wholesale in order to increase his income so that he can fully meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Aramanzani

texts.en:
Aramanzani is 45 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Aramanzani has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells ladies' clothes and handbags. 

To help expand his business, Aramanzani has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ladies' outfits, and will help Aramanzani to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Aramanzani hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another business. 

Aramanzani is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aramanzani who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' outfits.

loans.name: Otgontuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgontuul, 43, is a taxi driver who lives with her daughter in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic tent, in the 'ger' district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter has entered secondary school this year.  Mrs. Otgontuul has been running her taxi service for seven years.

Last year, her husband died from a serious illness. Now she has to be responsible to raise her daughter alone. For this reason, she decided to start a new business selling clothes beside her taxi business. As Otgontuul said, she will be using her loan to purchase the some casual clothes to expand the working capital of her new business and purchase the some new spare parts for her taxi to make repairs.

loans.use: To purchase the some casual clothes to expand the working capital of her new business and purchase the some new spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is married to Ann, and together they have two children. Both of their children attend school. He is a carpenter, and has been in the business for the past nine years. He earns a monthly income of approximately 40,000 KES.

This is his first loan request through KADET LTD. He would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase wood to make more furniture. He will use the anticipated profits resulting from the requested loan to purchase another molding machine. His dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 14 years. After realizing that his meager teacher's salary did not allow him to fully provide for his family, he ventured into the clothing business, and he has been in the business for a year.

His primary business challenge relates to the fact that he has limited funds to meet the high demand for his clothing. His dream is to set up a boutique and to educate his children. John is seeking this loan to buy clothes for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for resale purposes.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa is 54 years old. She is married.

Roquesa has a "sari-sari" or variety store which sells food items like canned goods, biscuits, chips, and candies. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, biscuits, chips, and candies.

Roquesa joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items like canned goods, chips, biscuits, and candies which are intended for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati lives in the Malindi area of the Coastal Province in Kenya. She is married and has two children: one child is in kindergarten level 1, and the other has not begun school.

She has been selling clothes by hawking around the town areas among her friends and other potential buyers. She was introduced to Milango in May 2011, when she applied for an initial loan to start the business. She successfully repaid her first loan and is now applying for another loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES, to help her restock the business and also to open a shop (behind her in the image).

Bahati has a goal of opening a boutique in this space and a salon in the near future. She is very grateful to Milango and its partners for their support. She hopes to conserve her energy since she will not be hawking anymore and to concentrate more on the business. She also notes that she will sell in cash rather than on credit. She expects to increase her income so that she is able pay for her one child’s education expenses and to better provide basic goods for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Более 25 лет он занимается услугами ремонтом бытовой техники. Он начал свою работу на маленьком помещение на своем кишлаке. До сегодняшней день, он несколько раз менял свое место бизнеса которые были арендованы. А теперь он имеет свое собственное помещения, где он продолжает свое мастерство. Он хотел бы получит займ для покупки запчастей в своем мастерском. От своего бизнеса он хочет получит хороший прибыл для того чтобы мог оплатит за учебу своего сына в ВУЗ.
texts.en: Bahrom is married and   the loving father of one child. For over 25 years old he has been providing a service repairing household electrics. He started his business in a small shop in his village. Until now he changed his business location several times as he had to lease space. Now he has his own shop where he keeps exercising his trade. He would like to receive a loan in order to buy spare parts for his shop. He would like to obtain good revenues from his business in order to be able to pay for his son’s college studies.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his repair shop

loans.name: Naran

texts.en: Naran, 51, makes swaddling-clothes and sells them at the bazaar called “Narantuul.” She lives with her 2 daughters in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 10 years she has been doing this business and already has gained a lot of customers who always buy swaddling-clothes from her in bulk quantities. Now she needs some money to increase her business working capital for expanding it. Therefore the loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing cotton-materials to make many more swaddling-clothes.

loans.use: to purchase some cotton-materials to make swaddling-clothes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 39-years-old and married to Daniel. Together they have three children aged 15,13 and six years-old. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 14 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 8,000 from  the business.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for use in the farm.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her dream is to expand her size of farm and increase the amount of fruits she farms.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and pesticides.

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is 38-years-old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Hafswa has been working hard to manage her produce store which sells fresh fruits, vegetables and other foodstuffs to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Hafswa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize millet and sugar, and will help Hafswa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hafswa hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Hafswa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Majidu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize millet and sugar.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a fifty-three year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his dream is a self sustaining family. He has been dealing in soft drinks for ten years. His hardship is insufficient capital and his vision is a bigger stable business plus educating children. Deo needs the loan to buy sodas to sell.

loans.use: to  buy sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita works hard to support her family. Benita is married and sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Benita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Benita has been in this business for 20 years.

Benita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is the father of 5 children with the youngest four still in school. He has been in farming in Kitale Western Kenya for over one year. He currently engages the services of one farmhand to carry out farming activities. He produces milk and maize for the local market.

Renson has requested for a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income from farming will  help him educate his children as well as provide milk for the family's consumption. He plans to be a major milk supplier for the local market.

Animal diseases remain his major challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 46-years-old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has six children all of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years Lawrence has been working hard to manage his store which makes and sells furniture. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more timber.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Dexter is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Dexter has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dexter hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is a twenty-seven year-old single man who owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in wholesale trade for one year. He began with 700,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is to have a capital of sixty million shillings and financial freedom. Isaiah needs a loan to  buy sugar, cooking oil, books and sodas.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, books and sodas.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 53 years old. She is married and has an adult child. 

Cresencia has a "sari-sari" store or a variety store where she sells canned goods, powdered milk, powdered coffee, snack items such as biscuits, bottled beverages, and vinegar. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more canned goods, powdered milk, powdered coffee, snack items such as biscuits, bottled beverages, and vinegar.

Cresencia joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, powdered coffee, powdered milk, snack items, bottled beverages, and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавжигул жительница района Джиликул. Ей 46 лет. Она занимается скотоводством. Уже 29 лет как она разводит скот у себя дома. В основном она разводит скот в дальней для продажи. Она замужем. У них четверо детей. Ее муж занимается растениеводством. Кроме того Мавжигул занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота и птицеводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Mavjigul is a resident of the Jilikul district.  She is 46 years old.  She is involved in animal husbandry and has been breeding livestock at home for 29 years.  Mavjigul primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in agriculture.  Besides this, Mavjigul is involved in breeding small livestock and poultry farming.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 37 years old and married with three children. He has been carrying out farming in Kitale town, Western Kenya for 16 years and currently employs one farmhand. His produce of maize, beans and poultry birds goes to the local market. In addition, he runs a timber hardware business in the local market.

Alex has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of another dairy cow will improve the family income and make life better, especially for the children. He is optimistic the business will continue to grow.

He laments of unreliable rainfall and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is a married woman and has two children. Iris is 28-years-old residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Iris owns and operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Iris has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Iris wants to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional  vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Divine est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  au Quartier Kamenge de la Mirie de Bujumbura.Elle fait le commerce de souliers pour hommes depuis 11.C'est un metier qu'elle commence apres sa sortie d'ecole qu'elle a fait jusqu'en 6e annee primaire.Elle est mariee a Willy et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l'ecole.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 400,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de souliers pour hommes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SIYONI».
texts.en:
Divine is a 30-year-old merchant who lives in "Kamenge de la Mirie", a neighborhood in Bujumbura. She's been selling men's shoes for eleven years. She started this business after finishing elementary school, which she attended until the sixth year.

She's married to Willy, and together they have six children, out of whom four attend school.

She's seeking a loan of BFI 400'000 to bolster her working capital and buy a lot of men's shoes for resale, in order to generate large profits.

She's a member of Siyoni Group.

loans.use: to buy a lot of men's shoes

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 59 years old. Her children are in school.

Elisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Elisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихтиёр женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он учитель, преподает в школе местном кишлаке. Его зарплата не хватает на содержание семьи и поэтому он решил заниматься дополнительным бизнесом. Вот уже более 10 лет Ихтиёр занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает ячмень и кукурузу, а также занимается откормом скота. Он хочет получит хороший прибыль для того чтобы улучшить свое благосостояния семьи. Ихтиёр хотел бы получит займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is a teacher, working at a local village school.  Since his salary was not sufficient to support the family, he decided to get involved in an additional business.  Ikhtiyor has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 10 years.  He grows barley and corn, and is also involved in fattening up livestock.  He wants to make a good profit in order to improve his family's livelihood.  Ikhtiyor wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of two heads of cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past six years Hussein has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale, and will help Hussein to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Hussein hopes that in the future he will be able to establish a wholesale shop in the local trading center. 

Hussein is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hussein who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Naftary

texts.en:
Naftary is a resident of Nkubu Town, Central Kenya where he practices farming and works as a clerk in a local coffee factory. He has had eight straight years in farming and currently produces milk, maize and coffee, which go to the local market. He is married with two children who are 5 and 3 years old. The oldest is already schooling.

Naftary has requested a loan of 78,750 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will improve his family living standards and help him educate his children. He adds that he plans to buy more dairy cows to expand the business.

Naftary, however, notes that animal diseases are a challenge to the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30-years-old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years Paul has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale and will help Paul to generate greater profits and increase the standard of living for his family. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to open a supermarket. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Ocherdene

texts.en: Ocherdene is 41-years-old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His children go to school. He started his garment retailing business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market. He is well known by his fashionable products. Now that winter is approaching he needs to sell more warm clothes. He is a strong and hard working man who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Marlene has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living Kim owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  Kim has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Kim joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Kim has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.736.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Kim is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Kim plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Kim là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Kim Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Kim thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Kim kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Kim đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Kim đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Kim dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 36-years-old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. Ahmed has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells food and home supplies along with mobile money. 

To help expand his business, Ahmed has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build his mobile money business and will help Ahmed to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ahmed hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Ahmed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahmed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to build his mobile money business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Gertrudes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Gertrudes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Melanie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Melanie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Versaldo

texts.en: Versaldo is a married man with three children. Versaldo is 55-years-old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Versaldo owns and operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living and this has been his business for 2 years. Each month, he earns 2,530.00 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 30,000.00 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Versaldo has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, Versaldo wants to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
 
Agripina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Agripina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agripina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Kamene is 35-years-old and married to Kamene. Together they have three children aged ten, six and four years old. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 13,000 from the business.

This is his third loan term in KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully.He will use the loan amount to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for use on the farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educucate and feed his family. His dream is to own a motorcycle

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Jovy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Majiduis

texts.en:
Majiduis 33-years-old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years Majidu has been working hard to manage his boutique which sells different kinds of clothes. 

To help expand his business, Majidu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Majidu to generate greater profits and expand his home. Majidu hopes that in the future he will be able to become a business expert and consultant. 

Majidu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Majidu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jolynda

texts.en:
Jolynda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jolynda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jolynda has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Jolynda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is a widow and has three children. Bernalda is 71-years-old and resides at Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Bernalda owns and operates a tailoring business to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 6,500 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase a sewing machine  and equipment for tailoring. Bernalda has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Bernalda wants to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine  and equipment for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Mustafa has been the owner of a cafeteria since 2008, where he prepares a variety of food choices. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2,100 in order to make a showcase and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a showcase and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of four children aged 22, 18, 8 and 6 years old; two of which are school going. She has a food kiosk and has been in the business for the past nine years. She gets a monthly income of KES 22,000.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase food stuff to cook and sell like maize flour beans, wheat flour, rice and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in her business and support her family budget. Her dream is to stabilize her business and expand it to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 30-years-old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past two years, Denis has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells different kinds of electronics. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more TV's and spare parts for phones, and will help Denis to generate greater profits and start building his own house. Denis hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale business. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more TV's and spare parts for phones.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.en:
Burmakan is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she has raised three sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at a university; the older son works in construction; the second son is in Russia; and the youngest son goes to kindergarten. In 1994, Burmakan started to sell seeds and cookies. During the years, she increased the commodity turnover. At the moment she sells home products, beverages, detergents, clothes and toys. Her monthly profit from this trade is about 16000 soms.  With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase more beverages, cookies and detergents to increase the assortment of goods she sells. In the future, Burmakan wishes to see all her children wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages, cookies and detergents.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

William has a motorcycle unit used to transport passengers in the village. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

William is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, William hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 60 years old. She is married to Daniel. Together they have three children, ages 10, 19 and 20. She sells GNLD products and has been in this business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan amount to buy GNLD drugs for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to meet her family's needs and reinvest in the business. Her dream is to establish herself in the business and fully meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells different kinds of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger clothes shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 50 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Cecilia sells finished food products like sausage to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to  purchase finished food products like sausage for her business. Cecilia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. Cecilia hopes to improve her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase finished food products like sausage for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her grocery shop and buy animal  feeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a 37-year-old single woman living in Ibabao, Siquijor, Siquijor, has been operating a grocery store to earn a living for the past three years, earning a monthly income of about PHP 5,000.00.

A member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month, Susan has requested a loan of 7000 pesos to buy more stock for her store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
From P-3 Manabay, Ozamiz City, Amor is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Amor has owned and operated a general store selling dry goods and beverages for over three years, earning approximately 9,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost a year, Amor is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000.00 which will be used to purchase more products to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Marife has a retail shop that sells vegetables like baguio beans, eggplants, and cabbages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Marife is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merabu

texts.en:
Merabu, a 39-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Iganga region of Uganda where, for the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop which sells mattresses.

To help expand her business, Merabu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more mattresses which will help her to generate greater profits and operate with larger inventories. She hopes that in the future she will be able to shift into selling wholesale.

Merabu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Merabu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock, like sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is married and has 5 children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.  Emerita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase livestock feeds.  Emerita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Emerita hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 54 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small restaurant, which sells and delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for cooking, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay for school fees. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to have the best restaurant in Pallisa town. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for cooking,

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga is married with five adult children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living. Domingga has been doing this for 20 years. Domingga has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm. 

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Corazon has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like afritada, caldereta, and pancit bihon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Corazon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Namuiima

texts.en:
Namuiima is 43 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Namuiima has been working hard to manage his market stand, which sells fresh produce. 

To help expand his business, Namuiima has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Namuiima to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Namuiima hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Namuiima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Namuiima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 23-year-old single woman. She has a child who is one year old. She describes herself as ambitious and determined. 

She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are ladies since she specializes in ladies and babies clothes. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. She will use the 10,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of clothes, especially as we approach the festive season. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a married woman who has two children. She is 37 years old, residing in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Richel has a farm, and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Richel has been a member of GDMPC for almost nine years. In the future, Richel wants to build house and to finished the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Delia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Delia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Binaisa

texts.en:
Binaisa is 46 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. For the past seventeen years, Binaisa has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells chairs. 

To help expand her business, Binaisa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bundles of cloth materials for making chairs, and will help Binaisa to generate greater profits and pay his bills. Binaisa hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Binaisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Binaisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of cloth materials for making chairs,

loans.name: Charity
