A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan that motivate borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans smoothly to receive half amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used he previous loans to open charcoal business, bought a pikipiki (motorcycle)for transport business, built rooms for renting and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wishes for a loan to go upcountry and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to still build rooms for renting.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Neema-Kimara" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To go upcountry and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Delia Andrea

texts.es:
Delia tiene 33 años y vive con sus cuatro hijos en Otavalo que esta en L. Provincia D. Imbabura. Delia se considera una persona muy alegre que le gusta su trabajo y es muy solidaria con las demás personas.

Delia trabaja en el terminal terrestre D. Otavalo en un puesto D. comidas por un tiempo D. tres años. Solicita créditos a Fodemi por tres años, el crédito actual es para L. compraD. una cocina industrial ya que L. que está utilizando es prestada y tiene que devolver, también utilizará el dinero para L. compra D. víveres para cocinar en su puesto, esta inversión le va a ayudar porque su puesto va a estar más presentable con L. cocina nueva y aumentando su negocio, sus ingresos van a ser buenos y podrá ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para aumentar su clienteL. y vender más ya que necesita tener mayores ingresos porque al momento no le alcanza para mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delia, 33, lives with her four children in Otavalo which is in Imbabura Province.  Delia considers herself to be a very cheerful person who enjoys her work and is very supportive of others.

She has had a food stand at the Otavalo land terminal for three years.  She has asked for Fodemi loans for three years.  The current loan is to buy an industrial stove because the one she’s using now is borrowed and she has to give it back.  She will also use the money to buy foodstuffs to cook in her stand.  

This investment will help her because her stand will be more presentable with the new stove and business will increase; her income will be good and she’ll be able to help her children to go to school.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own to increase clientele and sell more because she needs to earn higher income because it’s currently not enough to support her children.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Agnes has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Agnes sells her products from her home, by means of retail. Agnes has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes.  The main business challenges for Agnes include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler, to build rental rooms, and also to educate her children up to the university level. Agnes lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Cirila; la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia cambio de negocio actualmente ella se dedica al negocio de venta de mana (es como ojuelas a base de maiz),la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria,ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de mana. La socia requiere el crédito para comprar mana y tambien comprar maiz para preparar mana.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is Cirila; she is 41 years old and married with four children.  She works in retail.

Cirila changed businesses.  Currently she works selling "maná" (it's like a pancake made with corn).  She works as a street vendor and sells from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m.  With this business she gets her children ahead.

Cirila wants to expand and improve the business selling maná.  She needs the loan to buy maná wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy maiz to prepare corn pancakes.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos  3 varones de 27, 26, 21 años de edad, y la mujer de 12 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia compra tomates, habas, cebollas entre otras verduras y los lleva  a vender en la feria de Anta, la socia también tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual desea implementar ahora que se aproximan las fiestas navideñas, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de harinas en bolsas, arroz, en bolsas, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite y panetones, también comprara vino y champan para las fiestas navideñas. La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de productos como panetones, vinos, champan y los productos de primera necesidad, la socia también una parte lo destinara  a la compra de verduras para la venta inmediata. Ella desea con los ingresos de sus negocios terminar de comstruir su vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en: The borrower has four children, three boys who are 27, 26 and 21 years old and a 12-year-old daughter.  She’s a vegetable merchant.  She buys tomatoes, lima beans and onions, among other vegetables and sells them in the market in Anta.  She also has a grocery store that she wants to stock for the upcoming Christmas holidays.  She wants to use the loan to buy sacks of flour, bags of rice, noodles, milk, oil and panettones [traditional Christmas sweet bread].  She will also buy wine and champagne for the Christmas festivities.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of products like panettones, wine, champagne and basic staples and will use part of it to buy vegetables for immediate sale.  She wants to use income from her business to finish building her house and to continue supporting her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 27 years old and has three children. She is running a small shop that sells fruit. She earns 3,500,000 VND in profits from her shop. Joining in our credit program in 2009, she has received four loans and used them to expand her shop. To meet the extra demand of customers, she wants to borrow  9,184,000 VND to buy more kinds of fruit to attract customers to come.

loans.use: to buy  fruits to sell in retail

loans.name: Estrellas Del Mar Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DEL MAR AZUL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Lidia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de vajillas, venta de carne, venta de almohadas, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida.
 
La señora Lidia indica que hace cuatro años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de vajillas que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás, al iniciar el trabajo con Pro Mujer.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de vajillas) que compra de Oruro y posteriormente  lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The 'Estellas del Mar Azul' community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Lidia.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling cosmetics, selling dishes, selling meat, selling pillows and selling food.

Lidia says that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for four years.  She joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling dishes which she has been working in for four years, since she started working with Pro Mujer.

Lidia will use this loan to increase her capital (buying dishes).  She will buy her products in Oruro and then sell them in street markets.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has eight children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lidia replied that she likes the doctor's office.

loans.use: to buy dishes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large quantities of grocery products (Fanta, rice, beans, oil) to sell in order to make good profits and therefore increase her savings.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es: Los hijos de las socias tienen 22, 18, 16, 14 años de edad, La socia compra y vende verduras como tomate, zanahoria, cebollas en Chinchaypucllo; la socia lleva los productos a la feria, la socia también compra productos secos como trigo, papa, cebada, maíz; la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes en la misma zona y ella puede administrar su tiempo y sus dos actividades a la par. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos y en la compra de verduras. La socia desearía comprar terrenos de cultivos para cultivar verduras y maíz.
texts.en:
This member's children are 22, 18, 16, and 14 years old.  She buys and sells vegetables in Chinchaypucllo for a living such as tomatoes, carrots, and onions.  She brings her products to market.  She also buys dried products such as wheat, potatoes, barley, and corn.  She has a store in the same area where she can manage her time for both activities.  

She is requesting a loan to buy dried products and vegetables.  She would like to buy land so that she can grow vegetables and corn.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and dried products.

loans.name: Agabus

texts.en: Agabus is a fifty-year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling firewood for four years; he now has a contract of supplying mainly to a secondary school. His hardship is late payment and his vision is to expand his business and educate his children. Agabus needs the loan to buy land for trees to cut for firewood.

loans.use: to buy land for trees to cut for firewood.

loans.name: Sama

texts.fr:
Sama est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 3 enfants dont  2 scolarisés. L’ainé a 19 ans et le benjamin 7 ans.  
Sama travaille comme revendeuse depuis plusieurs années. Elle  achète et revend des produits d’alimentations générales genres sucres, laits, savons  à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa difficulté principale du moment est la mévente due à la saison des pluies.
 Sama a requis son premier  crédit  de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales, destinés à la vente. Elle pense réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans le développement de son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sama voudrait pérenniser son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de l’éducation de ces enfants.
texts.en: Sama is a 30-year old woman. She is married to a driver and has 3 children, 2 of which are in school.  The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.  Sama has worked as a retailer for several years.  She buys and resells groceries such as sugar, milk, and soap to all kinds of people in her store.  She sources at the main market in Lome. Her main difficulty is the slump in business during the rainy season.  Sama has asked for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products for resale.  She plans to reinvest the additional profits in developing her business.  In the coming years, Sama would like to sustain her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is 35 years old and has three children. She has had a shop that sells fruit in the local market for the past two years. Her business is more developed because she used loans from the SEDA credit program to buy a variety of fruits that come from different provinces to attract customers to come her shop. She finds that this kind of credit is very suitable for her business. Therefore, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in buying fruits in this new loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy fruits  for retail selling

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción, tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella actualmente vive con su esposo y cuatro nietos, ya tiene dos años D. administrar su tienda, cuenta Concepción que aprendió el negocio por pura necesidad. Su esposo se dedicaba a la venta D. frutas y verduras D. manera ambulante, pero esta Ella vio la situación por la que estaban pasando y le nace la inquietud D. iniciar una tienda, por lo que, le comento a su esposo y este le dijo que solo tenia disponible 140 dólares, y así comenzó a comprar y ha invertir en su tienda hasta que creció.

Para adquirir los productos que venD., Concepción debe caminar a pie unos cinco minutos, para abordar un autobús que se tarda una hora, para llegar a su destino y luego se traslada a su casa con la mercadería.

Ella solicita un préstamo, para comprar: 600 libras D. maíz, 100 libras D. fríjol, 200 libras D. arroz, 5 galones D. aceite, 8 cajas D. jabón, 10 cartones D. huevos, 100 libras D. papas, 300 huevos, tres docenas D. lejía, tomates, etc. D. esta manera, ella comprara a mejor precio, ya que será al por mayor y tendrá la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ganancias y obtener sus productos a buen precio. 

Con esta compra, ella satisfacera la demanda D. sus clientes, ya que, hay productos que estos buscan y ella no los tiene disponibles, al mismo tiempo le permitirá mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

La señora Concepción, desea sacar adelante a su familia, ella ahorra para comprar un terreno y construir su casa, porque en la actualidad viven en casa D. un familiar; también, desea en un futuro instalar un mini súper.
texts.en:
Concepción is 47 years old and married with two children. 

She currently lives with her husband and four grandchildren.  Concepción says she learnt the business out of pure necessity.  Her husband used to be a mobile fruit and vegetable seller.  On considering their situation, Concepción felt an urge to open a store, which she mentioned to her husband.  He told her he had only $140 to spare and this is how she began to buy produce and to invest in her store until it grew. 

In order to buy the products she sells, Concepción must walk five minutes to catch a bus, which takes one hour to reach her destination.  She then travels home with her goods.

She is asking for a loan to buy: 600 pounds of corn, 100 pounds of kidney beans, 200 pounds of rice, 5 gallons of oil, 8 boxes of soap, 10 cartons of eggs, 100 pounds of potatoes, 300 eggs, three dozen bottles of bleach, tomatoes etc.  By buying in bulk, she will be able to get her products at the best price, and she will have the opportunity to better her earnings and to get her products at a good price. 

With this purchase, she will be able to meet her client demand, as there are products that they want which she does not have available.  At the same time she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. 

Concepción wants to help her family get ahead.  She is saving to buy a plot of land and to build a house, because they currently live in a family member's house.  She also hopes one day to set up a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to buy 600 pounds of corn, 100 pounds of kidney beans, 200 pounds of rice, 5 galons of oil, 8 boxes of soap, 10 cartons of eggs, 100 pounds of potatoes, 300 eggs, three dozen bottles of bleach, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Aturanagyayo Association Group

texts.en: William is a 42-year-old Ugandan male who needs a loan to buy sugar for resale. The retail shop owner hails from the Kyenjojo district and is a father of four children, aged between eight and twenty-four. Having had this business for two years, he dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business and educating his children. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other access to a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 to 26 years. She describes herself as being ambitious and loving. She operates a charcoal sales business where she sells charcoal and sawdust to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to the stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to grow her business into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify to a timber sales business.

loans.use: To add to the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten, and pig feed

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo is a 39-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the tailoring business for 18 years and he acquired capital from farming. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Tadeo needs the loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Delia Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Delia Filomena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 52 años quien tiene una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años con un proyecto la cual se la instalo con todo y ella fue pagando poco a poco en un periodo de tres años. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos (azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles…etc.)
texts.en: Señora Delia Filomena is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  She is 52 years old and has a small grocery store.  She started this business 20 years ago as a project that she set up all on her own.  She paid slowly over a 3 year period.  She is married and has 3 children who are now adults.  She will use the loan to buy staple foods (sugar, oil, rice, beans....etc.).

loans.use: buy staple foods (sugar, oil, rice, beans....etc.).

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 44-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in the maize flour business for three years. She started with 200,000 shillings and now has 1,800,000 shillings. Her hardships are seasonal weather, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goal is to educate her children. Her business goal is to diversify her businesses. Jackline needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a single woman. She has a child who is 13 months old. She describes herself as polite, aggressive, and ambitious. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells sweaters. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy open-air market and her primary customers are retailers who buy to sell to end users. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to her stock of sweaters to boost business. Her business goal is to start importing sweaters in bulk from abroad within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot for herself.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters to sell

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica  a la crianza D. animales menores, la socia cría animales como chanchos, cuyes, gallinas, la socia los venD. al doble y dependiendo la epoca también varia el precio; la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra D. animales menores, ella comprar gallinas tiernas para criarlas la socia compra las gallinas a 15 soles cada una y las venD.  a 25 soles o 30 dependiendo el engorD. D. las gallinas, tambien comprara cuyes 10 pares y chanchos 2, para criarlos y para venderlos para año nuevo. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. gallinas, cuyes y chanchos. La socia desea a futuro corto comprar un terreno para cultivas.
texts.en: Jeronima currently raises small animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. She sells them at double the price she paid, and the price varies depending on the time of year. She wants to use the loan to buy small animals. She buys baby chicks to raise them; she buys chickens at 15 soles each and sells them for 25 or 30 soles, depending on how large they are. She will also buy 10 pairs of guinea pigs and 2 pigs, in order to raise them and sell them for the new year. She is asking for the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She would like to buy land in the near future to grow crops.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and none of her children goes to school. She operates a sewing machine from home. She has been in business for the last 20 years. Milly works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials. Her aspiration and goal is to buy an electric sewing machine to serve many customers in a short time. Her major business challenge is seasonality and the ever-increasing price of textiles. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Dawui

texts.fr:
Dawui est une femme de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å commerçant. Elle a 03 enfants, qui vont  à l’école. Le plus grand a 16ans et le plus petit a 07ans.  
Dawui travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois depuis 2008. Elle vend à toute personne à la maison. Elle travaille seule. 
Dawui a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bois et des sacs de charbon. Elle veut utiliser les profits supplémentaires pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
Dans les prochaines années, Dawui voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer la réussite de ses enfants sur le plan professionnel.
texts.en: Dawui is a 33 year old woman.  She is married to a businessman.  She has 3 children who attend school. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.  Dawui has worked as a retailer of firewood and wood charcoal since 2008.  She sells to everyone from her home.  She works alone.  Dawui is requesting her third round of loans from WAGES in order to purchase wood and bags of charcoal.  She will used the additional profits to pay for her children's education.  In the coming years, Dawui would like to have another point of sale.  She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure the professional success of her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of wood charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, vegetable oil, and bags of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION - ANTA”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Anta en la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de granos, la socia compra habas, maíz amarillo, blanco, papa seca, frejoles, porotos, pallares, cereales; La socia trabaja vendiendo productos en el mercado , ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos secos al por mayor de su proveedora y para ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos, la socia con lo que ingresa de sus ventas lo invierte en los estudios de su hijo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta," which is located the Anta district of Cusco, Peru.

She is 37 years old, married and has an 18 year old son.  She works buying and selling grain. She buys lima beans, yellow and white corn, dried potatoes, kidney beans and pallar beans.  Felicitas sells her products in the market and plans to invest the loan in dried goods which she gets at a wholesale price from her supplier.  Money earned from her investment will go towards her son's education.  

Felicitas is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: invest in dried goods.

loans.name: Canter Group

texts.en:
Octavian, who is in his early 30s is single.  He has had a t-shirt printing business for two years.  He works from 8 a.m to 8.30 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy equipment for the printing business and has paid his loan back successfully.  He wants a loan to buy another printing machine and a computer.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Canter" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy another printing machine and a computer

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN ANDRES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Asunta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de busos, compra y venta de fierro, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas, venta de carne.
 
La señora Asunta indica que hace doce años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, aceite, azúcar, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y ahorros.
texts.en:
The “SAN ANDRES” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The bank has six members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Asunta.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are varied and include: making tracksuits, buying and selling iron, running a neighborhood store, selling sweaters and selling meat.  

Asunta tells us that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for twelve years.  She joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a neighborhood store where she has been working for years.  

Asunta will use this loan to increase her capital (buying noodles, oil, sugar, etc.)  She will buy her products in La Ceja and then sell them from her sales premises.  This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Asunta replied taht she likes the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
Bertha María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, cosméticos y productos escolares. Este negocio lo inicio hace 18 años con un pequeño tramo en el mercado local. Ella está casada su esposo es fontanero y tiene un hijo.
Ella invertirá en camisas, camisetas, bóxer y cuadernos.
texts.en:
Bertha María is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who sells underwear, cosmetics and school supplies.  She started her business 18 years ago with a small stand in the local market.  She is married and her husband is a plumber.  She has one son.

Bertha María will invest in buying shirts, t-shirts, boxer shorts and composition books.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shirts, t-shirts, boxer shorts and composition books)

loans.name: Gamal

texts.fr:
Gamal est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse, et n’ont pas encore d’enfant.
Gamal travaille comme revendeur depuis 2009. Il achète et revend des téléphones portables à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Il achète les produits auprès des grossistes de Lomé et  travaille  avec un membre de la famille. 
Gamal a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter de nouvelles  arrivages de téléphones portables destinés à la vente. Il pense réinvestir ces profits dans l’agrandissement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Gamal voudrait développer son commerce. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse et assurer l’éducation de ses frères.
texts.en: Gamal is a 28 year old man.  He is married to a retailer and they do not yet have children.  Gamal has been working as a retailer since 2009. He buys and resells mobile phones to all people in a store.  He buys his products from wholesalers in Lome and works with a family member. Gamal is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy new arrivals of mobile phones for sale.  He is thinking of reinvesting these profits in the expansion of his business.  In the coming years, Gamal would like to develop his business.  He says that with the profits, he plans to have a happy family and to ensure the education of his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sauce condiments, caned foods, and trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Arlen José

texts.es:
El señor Arlen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 28 años quien tiene una pequeña agencia de distribución de gas butano y agua purificada. Este negocio lo inicio hace dos años con unos ahorros con el fin de salir adelante, el negocio en este tiempo ha crecido y cuenta con un trabajador.
Su meta es salir adelante y seguir creciendo es por ello invertirá el crédito en el negocio.
texts.en: Arlen, 28 years old, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has a small butane gas and purified water distribution agency. She started this business two years ago with some savings and with the goal of moving ahead. The business has grown in this time and employs a worker. Her goal is to move ahead and continue growing, and for this reason she will invest the loan in the business.

loans.use: to purchase butane gas and potable water

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia en la actualidad a prosperado y a abierto su kiosko escolar en uno de los colegios mixtos de la zona, la socia a implementado su tienda escolar con golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, sandwich de queso, de pollo, de jamon, de carne, de huevo; la socia también vende a los profesores del colegio y prepara cafes, mates, tes; La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, panes, chisitos y todo lo que se requiere para implementar en un kiosko escolar. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de caramelos, gaseosas y otras golosinas para implementar el kiosko escolar de la socia.
texts.en:
Currently Juana is prospering and has opened a kiosk in a coeducational high school in her area. She has established her stand selling sweets, soft drinks, cookies, and cheese, chicken, and ham sandwiches. She also sells to teachers at the school and prepares coffee, mate, and tea.

On this occasion, Juana wants to invest in the purchase of sweets, soft drinks, cookies, breads, snacks, and everything needed in order to operate her kiosk. She is applying for the loan in order to invest in the purchase of candy, soft drinks and other sweets for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and soft drinks to sell at a kiosk on the grounds of a high school.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is 21 years old with two small children. She is managing a shop that sells ceramic products such as bowls, plates, spoons etc.  Her business started in 2009, one year after accessing a loan. Her business creates a very stable income for her. Regarding her repayment situation, she is always  a good re-payer. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more kinds of new products to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more ceramic products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 9 years old to 24 years old. She describes herself as joyous. She operates a café where she cakes and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient capital and seasonality. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of soft drinks and cakes. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cakes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Djaharatou

texts.fr:
Djaharatou est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un électricien de profession. Elle a 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. L’ainé des enfants a 10 ans  et le benjamin 3 ans. 
Djaharatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend des bijoux genres boucles d’oreilles, les colliers, les bracelets à toutes personnes à son domicile.
Djaharatou a requis son quatrième crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter bijoux destinés à la vente. Elle pense réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans l’agrandissement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Djaharatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de bijoux. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Djaharatou is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to an electrician by trade. She has four children, of whom two are in school. The oldest of the children is 10 years old, and the youngest is 3. Djaharatou has been working as a retailer since 2005. She buys jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, and she sells them out of her house to anyone.

Djaharatou has requested her fourth loan from WAGES to buy jewelry for resale. She is thinking of reinvesting these extra profits to expand her business. In the next few years, she would like to open a store for selling jewelry. With the profits, she says she plans on ensuring that the family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 30 años, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura. Marco se describe como una persona trabajadora y honesta.

Marco trabaja con su esposa en su tienda, Marco trabaja desde que era niño con la ayuda de sus padres lo cual le ha hecho muy responsable con su familia. Por un tiempo de seis meses trabaja con Fodemi, el actual crédito es para abastecer su negocio de víveres y productos, para poder aumentar sus ventas ya que hay clientes que le solicitan cierto producto y no tiene, esta inversión es muy importante porque mejorarán sus ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es poder incrementar su negocio y ver crecer bien a sus hijos con una buena educación.
texts.en:
Marco is 30 years old.  He is married, has three children, and lives with his family in Atuntaqui, 15 minutes from Ibarra, in Imbabura province.  Marco describes himself as a hard-working and honest person.

Marco works with his wife in their store.  He has been working since he was a young boy, with the help of his parents.  This has made him very responsible towards his family.  Marco has been working with Fodemi for six months.  He will use this current loan to stock his store with food and other products so that he can increase his sales.  He has customers who are requesting certain products from him which he doesn't have.  This investment is very important because it will enable him to improve his income.

Marco's dream is to be able to increase his business and watch his children grow up well with a good education.

loans.use: to stock his store with food and other products

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old single woman. She has two children between 22 and 24 years old. She describes herself as calm and kind. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries to the local people. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to add to her stock of groceries. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable, educate her children at the university and buy a plot of land for herself.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Wangninangbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNINANGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un sixième prêt. La représentante du groupe, Augustine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Augustine est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Salami. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Augustine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Augustine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Augustine vend divers produits (sacs, savons, chaussures) par le système de distribution. Augustine mène cette activité depuis  cinq ans, ce qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Augustine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité tout en la diversifiant, et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Augustine sollicite, avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE, un sixième crédit. Les crédits précédents ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: “Wangninangbe” is a group of three individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. In order to expand their business and meet customer demand, the group members turned to ALIDé, with the goal of obtaining their sixth loan. The group’s representative, Augustine (raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old. Augustine is married to Salami, a businessman. They have two dependent children, both in school. Augustine lives together with her husband and children. Augustine never attended school. In order to support herself, Augustine sells various products (bags, soap, shoes) through a distribution system. Augustine has been working in this business for five years and earning substantial revenues. Augustine buys her goods in a town of Benin. In order to diversify and grow her business, and better respond to the ever growing customer demand, Augustine, together with the other members of the Wangninangbe group, is seeking a sixth loan. The previous loans have all been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, bags and shoes

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Tham is 26 years old with two children. She is running a shop that sells fresh fruits in the local market. Her business started in 2010. Every month, she earns 5,500,000 VND profit. She used the loans from SEDA credit program in 2008 to invest in a fruit shop. She finds that it is very suitable to her earning activity. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy fruits for retail selling.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El hadji est un homme de 38 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 2 ans. Il est  commerçant  et s’active dans la vente de chapelets  depuis  plus de 10 ans. Il a fréquenté l’école coranique depuis son enfance et par la suite il s’est orienté dans ce volet par  passion, mais  aussi sur la recommandation de ses parents. Il est surtout intéressé par l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2010. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chapelet en vue de renforcer son  stock et aussi de le diversifier. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. El Hadji is a 38-year old man who lives in Senegal. He is married and father of one 2-year old child.  He is a merchant and has been active in the sale of rosaries for more than 10 years.  He has attended an Islamic school since childhood and subsequently decided on his direction because of passion but also at the recommendation of his parents. He is especially interested in the lucrative nature of his business. He has been a member of a branch of UIMCEC since February 2010. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase rosaries to strengthen his inventory and also to diversify it.  The increase in his profits will allow him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rosaries for resale.

loans.name: Rachael Kalunda

texts.en: Rachael is a widowed woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 25 years to 35 years old. She describes herself as quiet. She operates a retail store where she sells general items like sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of general items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of groceries in the area.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, beverages and detergents

loans.name: Tchintchane

texts.fr:
Tchintchane est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié à une couturière de profession. Il a 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 1 an.
Tchintchane travaille comme soudeur depuis 2009. Il fabrique des fenêtres et des portes en fer, répare des voitures cabossées, et fait le ferraillage à toutes personnes à son atelier. 
Tchintchane a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine et divers matériels de travail. Il pense réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans le développement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Tchintchane voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Tchintchane is a 33-year old man. He is married to a seamstress.  He has 2 children, 1 in school. The oldest is 5-years old and the youngest is 1-year old.  Tchintchane has worked as a welder since 2009.  He manufactures windows and iron doors, repairs dented cars, and makes reinforcements for all people at his workshop. Tchintchane is requesting is first WAGES loan in order to buy machinery and various work materials.  He plans to reinvest these additional profits in the development of his business.  In the coming years, Tchintchane would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he expects to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy machinery and various work materials.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Las edades de los hijos de la socia son de 20 y 19 años de edad, la socia actualmente se encuentra criando animales menores para la venta, la socia compra conejos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, ella los compra tiernos, los cría y engorda, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de animales menores para la crianza y la venta de los mismos. Ella invertira el credito enla compra de de animales menores como 10 pares de gallinas, 50 cuyes, 30 pollos. La socia desea a futuro tener su terreno propio de cultivo. La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de animlaes menores.
texts.en: This member’s children are aged 20 and 19. She currently raises young animals to sell them on. She buys rabbits, hens, chickens and guinea pigs. She buys them young, raises them and fattens them. The member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of young animals such as 10 pairs of hens, 50 guinea pigs and 30 chickens to raise them and then sell them. She would like to have her own plot of farming land in the future.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of young animals.

loans.name: Logan Javier

texts.es: El señor Logan es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de repuesto de motocicletas y video juegos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 4 años el cual inicio con poco actualmente  ha ido creciendo.  El invertirá el crédito en lubricantes, baterías rockert y ganher, llantas y video juegos.
texts.en: Logan is a hardworking and industrious man.  He makes his living selling video games and spare parts for motorcycles.  He started his business four years ago.  He started out with little but business has been growing.  He'll invest his loan in lubricants, Rocket and Gohner batteries, tires, and video games.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, tires, Rocket and Gohner batteries, and video games.

loans.name: Ayessi Group

texts.fr: AYESSI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Francisca Ablawa. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement et de diversifier leurs activités, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Francisca Ablawa est âgée de 64 ans et est mariée à un militaire retraité du nom de célestin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leurs charge. Francisca Ablawa vit avec sa famille et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges du ménage.Francisca Ablawa n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Francisca Ablawa  mène comme activité la vente de condiments, de riz et de poissons fumés dans son quartier. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Francisca Ablawa achète ses produits au Bénin. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Francisca Ablawa et aux autres membres du groupe AYESSI, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: AYESSI is a group consisting of three people whose representative (she with a raised hand in the photo) is named Francisca Ablawa.  The group members live in the same neighborhood. In order to increase their working capital and to diversify their business, this group is asking for their third loan from ALIDE.  Francisca Ablawa is 64-years old and married to a retired soldier named Celestin.  The couple have five children, all in school, two of which remain in their care.  Francsica Ablawa lives with her family and ensures together with her husband the various household expenses. Francisca did not attend school.  For about 10 years, Francisca has been in the business of selling condiments, rice, and smoked fish in her neighborhood.  This business generates income that helps her contribute to family expenses.  Francsica Ablawa buys her products in Benin. This third loan will certainly enable Francisca Ablawa and other members of the AYESSI group enhance the level of their business and grow their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, bags of rice, and fish.

loans.name: Rose Kalunda

texts.en:
Rose is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 25 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be talkative. 

She operates a restaurant business where she sells food to the local people. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan to introduce a butcher shop within the restaurant, where she will be selling meat. Her business goal is to open another restaurant in a different area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be owning many restaurants in various shopping centers in the Matuu area.

loans.use: To start up a butcher shop within the restaurant.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Le premier enfant a 7 ans et le benjamin 4 ans.
Yao travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il achète et revend des savons et des détergents à toutes personnes à son domicile et distribue aux clients dans leurs maisons. Il s’approvisionne régulièrement au Grand marché de Lomé. 
Yao a requis son premier  crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des savons et des détergents destinés à la vente. Il dit vouloir réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yao voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer le besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en: Yao is a 35-year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 2 children, of which 1 is in school. The oldest is 7-years old and the youngest is 4-years old.  Yao has worked as a reseller since 2010.  He buys and resells soap and detergent to all people at his home and he sells to customers at their homes.  He sources regularly at the main market of Lome.  Yao is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy soap and detergent for sale.  He says he wants to reinvest these additional profits in his business.  In the coming years, Yao would like to open a store.  He says that with the profits, he expects to guarantee the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela tiene 63 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive con sus 04 hijos en su casa propia. Hace unos años que su esposo falleció y lo que más desea ahora en adelante es vivir una vejez tranquila. Carmela a pesar D. su edad continúa trabajando en la agricultura, cultivando cacao, café y plantas D. barbasco. Es así que desD. temprando se dirige a sus campos, pues sabe que las ganancias que percibe dependerá mucho en la manera como cuida sus plantas. Asimismo también se encarga D. trasladar sus productos  desD. su comunidad D. Palmapampa hasta los centros D. acopio ubicado en la ciudad D. San Francisco, donD. los precios que ofrecen por sus productos son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos, pues debe procurar que la plaga D. insectos no afectar sus frutos y eso haría reducir sus ganancias. Tiene 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en temporada D. lluvia, porque perjudican el rendimiento D. su trabajo. En el futuro espera trabajar con el mismo empeño. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, por ello espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes D. trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará sacos D. abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carmela, 63, is a very modest and hardworking woman.  She lives with her four children in her own home.  Her husband passed away a few years ago and what she wants most from now on is to live a peaceful old age.

In spite of her age, Carmela continues working in agriculture, growing cacao, coffee, and barbasco plants.  So from early in the morning she goes to her fields, since she knows that the profits she earns will depend a lot on how she takes care of her plants.  At the same time she also is in charge of taking her products from her community of Palmapampa to the distribution centers located in the city of San Francisco where the prices they offer for her products are very good.

What she likes most about her job is taking care of her sown fields, since she needs to make sure that insect pests don't affect her crops and so reduce her profit.  She has been doing this work for 40 years and considers the hardest part to be working during the rainy season because it damages her job performance.  She hopes to work with the same dedication in the future.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her work plans.

With the money requested she will buy bags of fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 25 años, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años, vive con su familia en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la provincia de Imbabura. Eduardo se describe como una persona trabajadora, honesta y alegre.

Eduardo trabaja con su esposa en la carpintería, elaborando muebles de madera. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de madera y laca para que sus productos terminados sean de buena calidad y sean competentes en el mercado y así lograr buenas ventas y buenos ingresos económicos lo que le ayudará a mantener a su familia. En un futuro piensa ampliar su negocio y poder emplear a personas que necesiten trabajar, y con las ganancias que tenga poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 25, married, and has a four year-old son. He lives with his family in Atuntaqui which is 15 minutes from Ibarra in Imbabura province. Eduardo describes himself as a person who is hard-working, honest and cheerful. 

Eduardo works with his wife doing carpentry. They make wood furniture. This is the second loan with Fodemi that he is applying for, and he will use it to buy wood and lacquer so that his finished products will be of good quality, and competitive in the market. In this way he will achieve good sales and a good income, which will help him support his family. 

In the future he is thinking of expanding his business, being able to employ people who need work, and with his earnings, building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy wood and lacquer so that his products will be of good quality.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 58 años y ella se dedica aún a la elaboración D. comidas caceras y a la compra y venta D. animales, a la agricultura; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra D. gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, conejitos, la socia comprara estos animales tiernos para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos, la socia tiene pensado comprar 10 pares D. gallinas, pollos, cuyes 20, para criarlos engordarlos y venderlos, la socia también desea invertir parte del credito en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboracion D. sus comiditas caseras. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. gallinas, cuyes, pollos y D. ingredientes para elaborar las comidas  caceras.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 58, and still works making homemaD. meals, buying and selling animals, and farming. On this occasion, she wants to use the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and baby rabbits. 

She will buy these animals young, in order to raise them, fatten them, and sell them. She is thinking of buying 10 pairs of hens, other chickens and 20 guinea pigs, in order to raise them, fatten them, and sell them.

She also wishes to use part of the loan to buy ingredients for making her homemaD. meals. She is applying for the loan to buy hens, other chickens, guinea pigs, and ingredients for making homemaD. meals.

loans.use: To buy hens, other chickens, guinea pigs, and ingredients for making her homemade meals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 24-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be social. She operates a beauty salon business, where she offers hair and beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be stiff competition and power rationing. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a steamer for treating hair. Her business goal is to own a modern salon salon, with all the salon equipment needed to give the best touch to all clients, within five years.

loans.use: To purchase a steamer for treating hair.

loans.name: Yédéba

texts.fr:
Yédéba est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée à un policier. Elle a un enfant de 7 ans scolarisé.  
Yédéba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des chaussures et des bijoux à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. 
Yédéba a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures destinées à la vente. Elle pense diversifier sa marchandise avec ces profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yédéba voudrait élargir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en: Yédéba is a 38-year old woman. She is married to a police officer.  She has one 7-year old child in school. Yédéba has worked as a retailer since 2007.  She buys and resells shoes and jewelry to all people at her home.  She sources at the main market in Lomé.  Yédéba is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes for sale.  She is thinking of diversifying her merchandise with these additional profits. In the coming years, Yédéba would like to expand her customer base.  She says that with the profits, she expects to guarantee the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es:
La señora silvestra es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años vendiendo lo que produce  su esposo y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en la compra de otros productos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en cosechas de naranjas y bananos.
texts.en: Silvestra is a hardworking, enterprising woman who sells fruit and vegetables.  She started this business 20 years ago selling what her husband produces and gradually started to buy other products.  She will use the loan to buy orange and banana crops.

loans.use: to buy orange and banana crops.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking and determined. He operates a shoe sales business, where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more shoes to meet demand, especially during this festive season. His business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un maçon et a 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier enfant a 9 ans et le dernier a 3 ans. 
Abra travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1985.  Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle achète ces produits au grand marché de Lomé et est souvent aidée par ses enfants dans son activité.  
Abra a requis son troisième crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales destinés à la vente. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, développer une autre activité secondaire.
Dans les prochaines années, Abra voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Abra is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a mason and has three children all attending school. The eldest child is 9 years old and the youngest is three.

Abra has been working as a retail merchant since 1985. She buys and sells grocery products to all-comers from her home. She gets her supplies from the great market in Lomé and is often assisted by her children in running her business.

Abra has requested her third WAGES credit loan to purchase grocery products for resale. With the profits gained from her business, she wants to develop another sideline activity. In coming years, Abra would like to expand her business. She said that with the profits she expects to pay for their children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Wassiou

texts.fr:
Wassiou est un homme de 24 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Wassiou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale (sac de riz, bidon d’huile, eau minérale, les boite de conserve) dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale c’est les temps de mévente après les fêtes de fin d’année. 
Wassiou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, de l’huile végétale et des paquets de papier hygiénique. Il veut épargner les profits supplémentaires à WAGES afin d’augmenter à chaque fois le montant de ses emprunts. 
Dans les prochaines années, Wassiou voudrait développer son activité en ouvrant d’autres boutiques dans le centre ville. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’envoyer ses futurs enfants à l’école et au même moment les amener à avoir un engouement pour les micros finances, spécifiquement WAGES.
texts.en:
Wassiou is a 24-year-old man. He is single with no children.

Wassiou has been working as a retail merchant since 2010. He sells grocery products (bags of rice, vegetable oil, mineral water, canned goods) in his shop. At this time, his main difficulty is the slump in sales after the holiday season.

Wassiou requested his first WAGES credit loan to purchase bags of rice, vegetable oil and packages of toilet paper. He wants to set aside his additional profits with WAGES so that he can increase the amount borrowed at the next loan cycle.

In coming years, Wassiou would like to expand his business by opening more shops in the city center. He said that with the profits, he plans to send his future children to school and at the same time get them to develop an interest in micro finance institutions, in particular WAGES.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo de 66 años y sus 4 venerados hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Emiliana, junto a su esposo trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, ya que sabe que sus productos que obtenga en sus tierras serán de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, ya que estos son los productos que mejor se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar permanente junto a sus cultivos. Emiliana lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será el crédito número 04 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo  de ustedes, así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo; por otro lado  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos son muy responsables. Los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará sacos de abono para obtener mejores productos.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 49, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Segundo, 66, and their beloved four children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Emiliana works alongside her husband in the fields every day. With much effort she’s managed to make her farmland more productive and she knows that the products she’ll obtain from her soil will be of quality.  She mainly farms cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf since they are the products that sell the best at market.  

What she most enjoys about her work is permanently being near her crops.  Emiliana has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the crops all the way to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  For her business’ future she hopes to gather enough money to buy new land.

This will be loan #4 with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she’ll have your support because she’ll feel sure about making progress with her work.  She also commits to continue making her installment payments like she did with previous loans she got.  

It pleases her to be part of a communal bank because everyone is very responsible.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to improve her crops.  To do so, she’ll buy sacks of manure to obtain better products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Joshua Nyulia

texts.en: Joshua is a 41-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years old. He describes himself as visionary.  He operates a shoe sales business where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more shoes to meet the demand, especially during this festive season. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Renovación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renovación está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jenny quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y prendas. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años con unos ahorros luego como vio que necesitaba más inversión empezó a prestar en Adim. En la actualidad cuenta con tres trabajadores quienes distribuyen la mercadería.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial ropa por la temporada.
Las otras integrantes son Magda Rosa de 51 años quien tiene una pequeña pulpería y Leyla  vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: The “Renovación” group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Jenny who sells clothes.  She started this business ten years ago with some savings and then when she saw that she needed to invest more started to borrow from Adim.  She currently has three employees who sell the merchandise.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, especially seasonal items.  The other group members are Magda Rosa, 51, who has a small grocery store and Leyla who sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Wilson Fernando

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en Atuntaqui que está a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura. Wilson se describe como una persona alegre, honesta y trabajadora.

Wilson trabaja solo en la carpintería, elaborando muebles de madera. Es el segundo crédtio que le solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de madera lo que ayudará a que aumente su producción, sus ventas e ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño para los proximos cinco años es ampliar su negocio y poder emplear a personas que necesiten trabajar.
texts.en:
Wilson, 23, lives with his parents in Atuntaqui which is 15 minutes from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.  He describes himself as a cheerful, honest and hardworking person.

He works alone in a carpentry shop making wood furniture.  This is the second loan he’s requested from Fodemi that he is going to use to buy lumber to increase production, sales and income to improve his quality of life.  His five-year plan is to expand the business to be able to employ people who need jobs.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize and fresh fish to cook.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée à  un délégué médical. Elle est mère d’un enfant de 04ans qui fréquente dans une école du quartier. 
Enyonam travaille comme revendeuse des boissons de la BB depuis 11ans. Elle sert tous les clients dans sa boutique. Elle travaille avec 01 employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Enyonam a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt  à WAGES afin d’acheter des casiers de boisson. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Enyonam voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle  veut avoir une  famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Enyonam is a 38-year-old woman. She is married to a medical representative. She is the mother of a four-year-old child attending a local school.

For the past 11 years Enyonam has been retailing BB beverages. With one employee, she serves all her customers at her bar.

Enyonam requested a second credit loan from WAGES to buy crates of beverages. She wants to reinvest extra profits into her business activity. In coming years, Enyonam wants to expand her business. 

She said that with the profits, she wants to have a happy family.

loans.use: Buy beverages for the bar

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Los hijos d ela socia tienen 24, 20, 17, 15 años de edad, la socia se dedica  avarias actividades como la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, la crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes, ovejas y ahora plásticos para la epoca de lluvias, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de plastico al por mayor, la socia comprara plástico para la venta en su stand en la feria del pueblo, ella trae al por mayor de Juliaca y los vende por metros, la socia desearía en poco tiempo comprar un terreno para cultivar y vender la producción, la socia con los ingresos que generan sus ventas invierte en los estudios de sus hijos. La socia soliciate el prestamo para invertir en la compra de plásticos al por mayor.
texts.en: The member’s children are 24, 20, 17 and 15 years old.  She carries out a variety of activities like buying and selling clothes for women and men, raising animals like chickens, guinea pigs and sheep and now plastic sheeting for the rainy season.  She wants to use the loan to buy plastic at wholesale.  She will buy plastic to resell in her market stand in town.  She buys it at wholesale in Juliaca and then sells it by the meter.  She’d like to be able to buy a piece of farmland to cultivate shortly and sell her crops.  She invests income generated from her sales into her children’s education.  She is asking for the loan to buy plastic sheeting at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy plastics at wholesale.

loans.name: Agapitus Mukabi

texts.en: Agapitus is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 1 year to 5 years old.  He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail shop where he sells general items like sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages etc. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and poor transport network. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of general items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase a van to facilitate the running of the business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, detergents etc

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 61 años de edad, esta acompañada y vive con dos nietos de 20 y 12 años de edad.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse al comercio de mariscos, esto lo aprendió, por pura necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios de su casa, pero por ayudar con los gastos y superarse, ella decide emprender esta actividad.

A Maria le llevan el pescado los mayoristas, hasta su casa. Por lo que, no incurre en ningún gasto de transporte.

El préstamo que esta solicitando será invertido, en la compra de 10 quintales (1,000 libras) de pescado, que serán cancelados en su totalidad. Con esto ella reiniciara su negocio de venta de mariscos, ya que por problemas de salud lo dejo de hacer por un tiempo. 

Maria manifiesta, que su negocio era rentable cuando lo tenia, por eso comprara esas 1000 libras de pescado, que se las llevaran a su casa poco a poco, de esta manera mantendrá su negocio y generara ingresos suficientes, para el pago del crédito y para su consumo familiar. Con los ingresos ahorrara una parte, para comprar algunas cosas para su casa, mejorar el techo y ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with two grandchildren, aged 20 and 12. 

She is a hardworking woman. For four years, she has been working in the seafood business. She learned it out of the need to have a source of income for her family. Before she only took care of the house, but to help with expenses and get ahead, she decided to start this activity. 

Wholesaler bring Maria the fish to her house, so she has no transportation costs.  

The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying 10 quintales (1,000 pounds) of fish, which will be paid for in full. With this, she will re-start her seafood selling business, since due to health problems she had to leave it for a while. 

Maria says that her business was profitable when she had it, and that is why she will buy 1000 pounds of fish. They will take it to her house little by little and this way she will maintain her business and generate enough income to pay for the loan and for her family's consumption. With the income, she will save a little to buy a few things for her house, improve the roof and make an addition.

loans.use: to buy 1000 pounds of fish.

loans.name: Las Mañanitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las mañanitas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Walkiria de 41 años quien es comerciante de Juguetes, adornos y Florecillas artificiales desde hace 10 años en un pequeño puesto del mercado. Ella cuenta con dos trabajadores e invertirá el crédito en florescillas y juguetes.
Las otras integrantes son Gloria de los Ángeles de 20 años quien vende ropa y calzado desde hace 6 años y Martha Raquel de 27 años  quien vende productos de limpieza y cosméticos desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Las Mañanitas” group is composed of three hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Walkiria, 41, who has been selling toys, decorations and artificial flowers in a small stand in the market.  She has two employees and will use the loan to buy flowers and toys.

The other group members are Gloria de los Ángeles, 20, who has been selling clothes and footwear for the last 6 years and Martha Raquel, 27, who has been selling cleaning supplies and cosmetics for the last three years.

loans.use: to buy flowers and toys.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La socia en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y de granos secos, la socia vende en el mercado en su stand granos como trigo, moraya, papa, cereales entre otros, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos secos y de animales menores para mejorar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como gallinas 10 y cuyes 10, también comprara productos secos como moraya, entre otros.
texts.en: The borrower currently works raising small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens and dry grains.  She sells grains like wheat, dehydrated potato and cereals, among others in her market stall.  She wants to use the loan to buy dry goods and small farm animals to improve her profits.  She is asking for the loan to buy small farm animals like 10 guinea pigs and 10 chickens and also to buy dry goods like dehydrated potato, among others.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals and dry goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted soaps for sale.

loans.name: Patrick Arnaud Gildas

texts.fr:
Client de 37 ans , celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 13 ans. A la fin de ses etudes il se lance dans la vente des poissons de mer fumes comme le hareng et la maquerelle.Ses ventes ont largement augmentes, il a des recettes de 150.000 a 450.000 frs par jour et a commence a faire la vente en gros et demi gros, des cartons de poissons qu'elle va acheter a Pointe Noire.

Il a déjà bénéficié de trois cycles de prêt, il a rembourse son prêt avec succès et a fait des épargnes énormes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises, il va acheter 25 cartons de hareng et 20 cartons de maquerelles qu'il livre chez vendeurs du marche.
Tres ambitieux, il tient a aller jusqu'au bout devenir un grossiste et un homme d'affaire important de ce pays .
texts.en:
This customer is 37 years old, single with 2 children aged 13 and 3 years. At the end of his studies he began to sell smoked salt-water fish such as herring and mackerel.

His sales have greatly increased, to the point where his income is now between 150,000 francs and 450,000 per day. He has begun selling cartons of fish wholesale or semi-wholesale, which he buys in Pointe Noire.

He has already been granted three loan cycles, successfully repaid his loans and made huge savings. With this new loan, he will strengthen his stock supply by purchasing 25 cartons of herring and 20 boxes of mackerels he then delivers to market retailers.

Very ambitious, he wants to go all the way : become a wholesaler and a prominent businessman in this country.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish: herring, mackerel

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un maintenancier et à un enfant de 7 ans scolarisé.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des cartes de recharge pour téléphone portable à toutes personnes dans une boutique. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge destinée à la vente. Elle pense avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, diversifier sa marchandise.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a maintenance staff person and has a 7-year-old child attending school.

Afi has been working as a retailer since 2007. She buys and sells recharge cards for mobile phones to all-comers in a shop.
